story:
We are Quintessential Design, a diverse team driven by the belief that there is only one SMART goal when it comes to helmets. We have designed a helmet that thinks about your safety, so you can stay focussed on your ride. Quin is the smart helmet that finally brings motorcycle helmet safety up to speed with the 21st century, and makes it accessible to every rider.

 

 

 

 

Quin Helmets use technology to deliver essential safety solutions, focussing on three main areas. These are: 

All this tech comes comes seamlessly integrated in a range of 3 helmet models and in 6 Unique design options. Each Helmet has been designed with unique riding cultures in mind.  

OH... and Quin Helmets are super light weight.

Simply put, Quin Helmets provide modern safety essentials without asking you to compromise on style, comfort or performance. It's technology ... your way.

Quin is committed to providing the most essential safety for riders. This means providing features that every rider needs and can make use of. If you haven't noticed ... 

The power of Quin's innovation lies at the heart of the helmet: The Arc Chip™. No bigger than a coin, The Arc Chip™ has a range of sensors that help detect any force from a crash to a slight bump. 

 

Helmets haven't been upgraded to provide connectivity that serves riders well. Most bluetooth is retro-fitted, making it bulky, obtrusive, and low-performing. 

On the other hand, there are new entries trying to test sci-fi, futuristic tech that is still too experimental to be classified as safety-enhancing. This technology is not yet fully developed, leading to manufacturing failures still stuck in R&D.

Quin Helmets redefine modern safety essentials, providing unobtrusive technology, rider-focussed safety, and beautiful design. 

 

 

Quin Helmets have invisibly integrated bluetooth 4.0 connectivity, giving you handsfree access to the apps you are most likely to use - phone calls, music, maps navigation, intelligent personal assistant and more.

 

 The Quin Arc Chip™ allows Quin helmets to be ever evolving. Through DFU (Device Firmware Upgrade), Quin helmets upgrade via system updates that are easily loaded by running the Quin Firmware Upgrade through the micro-USB connection. Riders can also upload personal audio preferences for calls and music. 

 

The IntelliQuin™ smart system makes Quin Helmets the first motorcycle helmet to offer integrated Crash Detection and SOS Beacon. 

IntelliQuin™ Crash Detection uses smart algorithms that measure speed, rapid deceleration and the peak g-force. Upon detecting and double-authenticating a crash, the Quin Helmet triggers a Crash Alert to emergency contacts. 

 
 

 

The IntelliQuin™ SOS Beacon is a first-of-its-kind system for riders who need help on-the-move. Harassment or crime are just a couple of instances when you may be in trouble, but stuck without the option to stop and make a call for help. The IntelliQuin™ SOS beacon allows you to get help at a push of a button.

The SOS Beacon sends your live GPS location to nearby responders who can respond and coordinate with your location to provide support. It also triggers the IntelliQuin™ BLACKBOX, which auto-records ambient sound. This recording can be used to review the problem, and in serious cases, can be used as evidence of crime or harassment.

 The Quin App is the bridge between the user and the helmet. The App not only supports the core safety functionality of Quin Helmets, but also provides health data during a crash, safety tips, biker news and more. 

The App acts as the Rider's setup and trouble-shooting assistant for their Helmet, giving step-by-step guidance on pairing and more. It also lets the Rider know if they have a problem with their connection before they ride, by using the geo-fencing feature of our proprietary firmware. These core functionalities will be included in the first version App available for free for Quin Riders. 

The Quin App will also feature additional features like ride analysis, custom maps for weather and motorcyclist traffic, social and more. These non-safety critical features will be rolled out in the 2.0 version. 

Smart is cool, but the basics are still the basics. Quin Helmets are engineered to offer the safest options possible for hardware. Quin Helmets have been tested for DOT and ECE, which are the universal American and European standards respectively.

This is an important and exciting brag for us, because our helmet mold was expertly designed to both accommodate integrated technology, AND ensure the integrity of structural safety. ECE applies for all of Europe as well as Australia, New Zealand and Canada.

Style is really, really important to most motorcyclists. Getting rid of all the unnecessary gadgets and keeping the design clean and simple gives Quin Riders options to stay in control of the style of their ride. 

Quin full face helmets have quick-release windshields, chin straps, cheek pads, and chin skirts. These are essential safety features to ensure emergency medical assistance can be provided when needed.

Every rider know that Ventilation is incredibly important. Quin ventilation system puts you in control of your temperature. 

The interior lining of every Quin helmet is color-matched with quilted stitching. The liners are also removable, and washable ensuring the helmet stays hygienic. 

All Quin Helmet models feature a luxe-matte finish. It looks and feels buttery soft, but wears every bit as well as standard finishes.

If you are a Harley lover, cafe-racer addict or a sport bike aficionado, we have 3 open face models that will rev your engine. If full-face is your thing, we have both a standard and carbon fibre option for you. Our nude carbon Quin Ghost helmet has already been on the race track for Formula 3.

The Quin Ghost is a nude carbon fiber, race spec helmet developed especially for our racers. The Ghost is everything a racer needs - safe, comfortable, light weight, and light on design graphics. It’s so unobtrusive, it’s like it’s not even there… a Ghost.

The Quin McQ is designed and named after the King of Cool himself, Steve McQueen. The McQ is our open face model and comes in 3 design options. It mixes classic race patterns with a minimalist, modern twist.

The McQ's retro-meets-racer vibe harkens to both classic British designs of the 1960’s and modern Japanese-style influence on bike culture.

 The Quin SpitFire is an aggressive full face helmet that is both mean and minimalist. Whether you ride in studded leather jackets or wool blazers, this versatile helmet will suit your style.

 The SpitFire comes in 2 design options, providing 2 spins on dangerous-but-dapper style.

We don't outsource design, engineering, electrical embedding, and other parts of R&D, that can rack up a big bill through paying third party innovators. We are an all-in-one team, innovating every part of the helmet from scratch. This cuts down costs enormously, and helps us make sure our helmets work smoothly from the inside out. 

Safety is a key performance metric for Quin. Our price point has been determined by including accessibility to safety into the calculations.

story:
Genusee eyewear is Made in Flint, Michigan from recycled plastic water bottles as a result of the Flint Water Crisis. 

Our first frame style, the Roeper, is democratically designed to look great on everyone. It is available exclusively on Kickstarter as either prescription optical or sunglasses. 

Our goal is simple: do good for people and the planet using design and collaboration to be the change we want to see. 

Genusee is bringing a new manufacturing legacy to the city of Flint by creating jobs; turning the surplus of plastic waste caused by the man-made water crisis into closed loop eyewear.

It is not just about being able to recycle materials. We want to upcycle single use plastic into products that have more value and purpose. We are able to upcycle 15 water bottles with every purchase.

 

We will be launching with our first style, the Roeper. The original Made in Flint eyewear. 

Democratically designed to fit a variety of face shapes. The Roeper looks great as either prescription eyeglasses or sunglasses. 

Offered in two frame colors: Crystal Fog & Classic Black.

 

Every purchase includes a plano or prescription single-vision polycarbonate lens or CR-39 tinted sun lens or readers.

All lenses are anti-reflective and UV protective. 

Additionally we will be able to fulfill requests for high-index, blue filter, prescription sun, and progressive lenses at a competitive additional cost. 

The Roeper frame style was designed to fit the median range of face shapes and sizes. If you are wondering if they will fit you, please compare the measurements to those of some of your other favorite eyewear. 

If we reach our $100,000 stretch goal, all of our backers will automatically receive our multi-use case. 

The case is also made from food-grade rPET and has a water tight seal. So you can say "No" to single-use water bottles and to-go cups. Use the Genusee Multi-Use Case to store your eyeglasses, as a water bottle, or container for your favorite green juice on-the-go. It is our way of trying to help you towards living a zero-waste life. 

Genusee is committed to making long term social and environmental impact in Flint - and beyond. Our four main goals are the North Star of every business decision we make. 

Only about 23% of single-use plastic water bottles are recycled nationally. This is a problem because it takes 450 years for a plastic water bottle to decompose in a landfill. Which means any piece of plastic you have ever used in your life time is still on this Earth - and then some.

At the height of the water crisis, the city of Flint was using more than 20 million water bottles a day to meet their daily needs. This resulted in a surplus of plastic being brought into the city. Post-use these bottles have been collected for recycling, re-processed, and resold outside of the city. Other corporations have been benefiting off of Flint's disaster. rPET is a valuable recycled material that could be used to create jobs, boost the local economy, and benefit the community who has been without clean water since April 24, 2014. 

Genusee prioritizes the use of pre-existing materials in the supply chain over creating new ones. By redesigning the lifecycle of plastic water bottles and upcycling bottles into a product of need and purpose Genusee is able to bring the value of rPET back into Flint - where it belongs.

 

Over 88% of the population in Flint does not have a college degree, yet there are 5 colleges within its city limits. This is a community that has been greatly affected by the outsourcing of the auto industry. In the 1970’s over 50% of the population worked in manufacturing jobs, and today only about 12% do. Many of these workers have been displaced and cannot find jobs that fit their skillset. 

Over 41% of the population lives below the poverty line - earning less than $12,082 annually. For those who are employed, 40% of that working population makes less than $10/hr.

There is a drastic disparity of income equality in Flint compared to the state and national averages. We are committed to bridging this gap by paying our workers above average salaries.The per capita income in Flint is $14,765 - compared to the state's $29,547 and national $56,430.

Eyeglasses can be manufactured with a basic understanding of tools and on-the-job skills training. By bringing a new manufacturing legacy to the city of Flint, and creating jobs that anyone can be trained to do - we will put people back to work by retraining and employing them in new skills and crafts. We want to generationally impact the lives of people in Flint and believe creating living wage jobs in diverse fields of interest is a key to social and economic justice. 

 

We are currently living in a paradigm of “fast - fashion” and linear economies. We buy, use, and throw away with little to no curiousity or knowledge of where our waste ends up, or it’s impact on the world around us.

It’s not just about recycling but designing products and systems from the onset of ideation to be closed loop. 

We want to make circularity as easy as possible for our users. We designed a unique Buy-Back Program that allows us to partner with YOU (the consumer) to take responsibility for our eyeglasses in the eco-system. 

When you are done using your Genusee eyewear we will buy them back from you for a credit towards your next pair. Yes. You heard us correctly, we will pay you for your used glasses. 

We will evaluate the quality and wear of the used eyeglasses, allowing us to do 1 of 3 things. Recycle the materials back into our supply chain, refurbish and resell at a discount to a value customer, or donate to those in need.

1% of profits are being donated to the Community Fund of Greater Flint. Donations will be distributed to two funds that address children's health and education in Flint: Flint Promise & Child Health and Development Fund. 

Lead is a serious and very dangerous neurotoxin. There is no safe level of lead exposure. Once it enters the body, the effects (depending on age of the person exposed) can be immediate, devastating and long lasting. 

There’s no way to remove lead from the body once it’s been absorbed into the bones. Therefore, we must find other ways to mitigate the devastating effects. Positive early childhood experiences and good nutrition can help limit the effects of lead on children and improve their behaviors and readiness for school. However, much more is needed. 

As we grapple with the effects of lead exposure, the Community Foundation’s Flint Child Health and Development Fund is focused on providing health and development interventions to support Flint’s children, throughout this crisis and beyond. Your purchase of Genusee will help our efforts to meet the long-term health and development needs of Flint children exposed to lead. Our children are in a fight, and with your help, they will win!

The Genusee Journey

In early 2016, Genusee’s co-founder Ali Rose VanOverbeke was in her hometown of Detroit volunteering with the American Red Cross during the Flint Water Crisis. While there, she observed the community facing not only a man-made disaster but, also a localized environmental crisis due to the surplus of plastic being brought into the city by NGO’s and aid organizations to meet the community’s daily needs.

Feeling a need to do something, Ali shared her experience with long-term collaborator and co-founder Jack Burns. Together, Ali and Jack began working on a design solution to address issues of plastic waste that would simultaneously create living wage jobs in Flint. They didn’t have an answer to the city’s problems. They simply knew they wanted to help.

Genusee was one of six companies to participate in the inaugural Elaine Gold Launch Pad program in partnership with the CFDA and the Accessories Council. During their time in the program, the team was awarded a micro-grant to further their business venture in Flint.

 

Risks and challenges

We have spent the last 2 years researching, prototyping and testing our current products and believe the risks are close to non-existent. We are working with eyewear consultants on all levels to ensure and mitigate problems as they arise. We have put our entire selves into to making this project a reality and are now reaching out to the Kickstarter community to finance our first production. We feel confident in saying that we are very capable of executing whatever it takes to run a successful campaign, and most importantly, to deliver the product on time.

We are excited about delivering our first products to our backers, and we will be completely engaged with our supporters during this process with full transparency. Any updates will be relayed in a timely manner, and we are open to any feedback or questions that arise along the way.

With your support, you won’t just be helping us to fund Genusee; you’ll be part of developing the future of Flint.

Forecasting Risk : Of course there can always be unforeseen matters/delays that we cannot control. But fortunately this rarely happens. If a problem comes up, our backers will be the first to know.

Acts of God : Events outside human control, like flash floods, tornadoes, earthquakes, or other natural disasters that could delay delivery.

If the information provided is not sufficient, please send you questions to the creators of the project.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Get the word out and make some noise about the campaign.
  • Use the Indiegogo share tools to share on social media.

story:
INTRO

The goal of this project is to make stunning, hand drawn, contemporary art affordable and accessible by producing it on athleisure clothing, Art on aPPAREL.... ArtPPAREL.  We partner globally with up and coming artists to showcase an "Artist of the Month" that produce new designs for our apparel. 

Hand drawn, asymmetrical art on apparel 

We leverage new printing and fabric technologies that makes the art "pop" creating the most fashionable and versatile apparel on the market today.  You can wear an ArtPPAREL masterpiece (athleisure shirt) ALL day, everyday, everywhere. 

Look great ALL day, everyday, everywhere

WikipediA - ath-lei-sure [ath-lee-zher]

Clothing designed for workouts and other athletic activities is worn in other settings such as the workplace, at school, or at other social occasions. Athleisure can be considered as a fashion industry movement, enabled by improved textile materials which allow sportswear to be more versatile, comfortable, and fashionable.

Athleisure Line -- 95% Polyester/ 5% Spandex

 

Wicking - Durable - Quick-dry - Comfortable - Easy care

PROJECT PERKS -- MASTERPIECE SHIRTS

Choice of 6 Inaugural designs

Our inaugural artist, TAY from Los Angeles, CA, created the designs for this campaign.  We have manufactured small quantities of these 6 Inaugural masterpiece shirts to make promotional videos and have Perks available for Christmas.  We hope to raise $20,000 to manufacture a large enough quantity of each design to provide these awesome athleisure shirts at an affordable cost of $25. 

Black Squiggles

Splish Splash

Frisky Feline

Jungle Love

Scattered Showers

White Squiggles

Please support our project by selecting Perks listed here.  Size charts are located at the bottom of the page.  If you like a loose fit, order one size bigger.  We guarantee that you will be satisfied with your fit or we will exchange it for free.

ArtPPAREL DIFFERENCE

"Open" Company

As an "open" company, we want to hear from you with suggestions of artists, favorite fabrics, designs and new product ideas.  ArtPPAREL will rock the fashion world with our diverse artists' designs and provide an online platform for these artists to distribute their artwork.  The advantage for ArtPPAREL and you, our customer, is that fresh designs will constantly flow from our partners. And, we can pass the savings of not having a design department on to you, keeping the art affordable. Twice a year we will manufacture a customer submitted  design and send the winner partner royalties. 

OUR PROCESS

Our process gives us (and you) complete control over fabric, design, style and cut.  We are weaving the cloth, selecting and printing the art, determining the cut/style, cutting the fabric, making the shirt, sewing in the artist's signature tag and producing the hanging artist bio tag.

We control entire process -- weave to tags

Our manufacturers spin over 200 different types of fabric. We have access to the latest textile technology to ensure that we continue to make easy to maintain, comfortable clothing that allows the art to "pop" and will wear well for years to come.  No ironing, shrinkage or cracked paint with an ArtPPAREL masterpiece. 

Over 200 different fabric choices

 

ArtPPAREL AFTER INDIEGOGO

http://www.ArtPPAREL.com

Not sold in stores.....online only....ArtPPAREL .com

After this campaign, we will be a 100% online venue, an e-commerce company.  Art on apparel will always be our primary mission.  We plan to expand our product offering to manufacture a complete family of products per design.  For example a round collar t-shirt, women's cuts in V-neck, tank and crop top, matching hats, tote bags, beach towels, phone cases, coffee mugs, backpacks and your suggestions.....no limits!

Multiple cuts of each design -- Spring 2018

 

SIZE CHARTS

 

 

ArtPPAREL FIT GUARANTEE

 

RISKS

Our biggest challenge is generating enough of an interest in a design.  Whereas we our weaving our own fabric, we need to make at least 180 of each design.  The risk is trying to give everyone their first choice.  In the event we do not have enough interest to make one of the Inaugural designs, we will offer alternatives or a refund. 

YOUR HELP

If you are not in a position to contribute now you can still help us.  If you are reading this, you obviously found us on Indiegogo.  Use the share tools built into this site to tell all your friends about ArtPPAREL.  Minimally, go to ArtPPAREL.com and join the "Paint the World" Club so that you will receive discounts and special offers direct to your inbox.  WE NEED YOUR HELP!!  Tell everyone you know about us.  Like us. Share us. Comment on us.  We greatly appreciate your help and we want to hear from you.
story_txt:
INTRO
The goal of this project is to make stunning, hand drawn, contemporary art affordable and accessible by producing it on athleisure clothing, Art on aPPAREL.... ArtPPAREL.  We partner globally with up and coming artists to showcase an "Artist of the Month" that produce new designs for our apparel. 

Hand drawn, asymmetrical art on apparel 
We leverage new printing and fabric technologies that makes the art "pop" creating the most fashionable and versatile apparel on the market today.  You can wear an ArtPPAREL masterpiece (athleisure shirt) ALL day, everyday, everywhere. 

Look great ALL day, everyday, everywhere
WikipediA - ath-lei-sure [ath-lee-zher]
Clothing designed for workouts and other athletic activities is worn in other settings such as the workplace, at school, or at other social occasions. Athleisure can be considered as a fashion industry movement, enabled by improved textile materials which allow sportswear to be more versatile, comfortable, and fashionable.
Athleisure Line -- 95% Polyester/ 5% Spandex
 
Wicking - Durable - Quick-dry - Comfortable - Easy care

story:
WE HAVE CREATED A HOLDER CALLED THE BUTTON BUDDY!


Buttons have been used in the United States since the first presidential inauguration in 1789, when George Washingtonâ€™s supporters wore buttons imprinted with a slogan. These early buttons were sewn to the lapel of a coat or worn as a pendant on a string. The first campaign buttons with photographs were produced to promote the political platform of Abraham Lincoln in 1860.

The simple Button Buddy Story

Originally I designed this holder for my brother who wanted to attach motivational sayings on high end cycling bikes, after realizing that the holder could be attached to anything and that in the 222 years pin back buttons have existed there has never been a holder we decided it was time to have a universal holder that could present pin back buttons universally. 

Taking our time we have designed the perfect holder that does just that.  From children to teens to adults everyone can find many ways to use it. These holders will come in three popular sizes. These Button Buddy holders attach easily to many popular existing products on the market today AND they can be used and attached over and over again. Today use it on a necklace and tomorrow a bracelet then the next day on your shoelaces. There are so many more creative ways to display your favorite self expressive pin back buttons using the Button Buddy holder youâ€™ll have fun finding new ways to use them.  Button Buddys is creating thousands of button designs along with the Button Buddy holders which will be available online and locally everywhere!

We are ready to take it  to production, packaging and the world. with connections and interested companies already we need additional help for tooling and packaging.

Its just me and my children and a few bigwig folks in the industry helping guide our way.

What is the Button Buddy?

There are literally millions of buttons out there, and equal to those, are the unique designs on them. With each button being made or manufactured for a different permanent use,  one would need to purchase many different products with a permanent button and design affixed to have multiple products. The Button Buddyâ„¢ holder allows you to have multiple uses from a single holder, while also allowing you to change the button design at will.  This provides versatility in product creation and creative customer products. Buttons are a enormous untapped market today. Itâ€™s hard to find buttons locally, but with The Button Buddyâ„¢ more buttons will be sold, more uses and excitement generated, with new uses and markets created by The Button Buddyâ„¢ holder.

The Button Buddyâ„¢ is a stylish button holder slightly larger than the button itself. The holder has a magnet in the center on top, where you place a favorite or popular button face side up to be displayed. The button clicks in place and is held securely until removed.  To get the button off the Button Buddyâ„¢ press the edge of the button, and the opposite edge is lifted and revealed. You then simply pull it off, and replace with another favorite button.  The Button Buddyâ„¢ comes in three sizes: Small, Medium and Large, which accommodate the standard 1â€, 1.25â€, and 1.5â€ inch buttons found in the market today. There are two shapes: Round and Square. Multiple colors are available: black, white, charcoal, red, yellow, pink, green earth and more are available. Also a custom message can be pad press printed or foil stamped on its edge for branding while the stylish buttons are displayed.

The Button Buddyâ„¢ can be used as the following, with the accompanying accessories.  VELCRO WRISTBAND, SILICON BRACELETS, COLORED ELASTIC CLOTH BRACELETS, SILICON SILLY BANDZ, METAL CHAIN, ROPE/STRING, LEATHER NECKLACES, HAIR PINS, HAIR TIES, RINGS, CUFF LINKS, SHOELACES, TIE TACK, BELT HOLE DECOR, HAT PIN, ZIPPER PULL, STICK-ONS, BIKE BAR BUTTONS, DOZENS OF KEY CHAIN TYPES, AUTO VISOR PIN, DASH BOARD STICK-ONS, BELT CLIPS, NAME BADGE ART, HUNDREDS OF PROMOTIONAL PRODUCTS, ATTACH TO PENCIL & PENS, LANYARDS, EARRINGS and MORE!!!....

The Market  Impact ( we're not getting turned away anywhere )

Not all products have such a wide and diverse ability to access so many markets. Because of itâ€™s design and the use the Button Buddy holder does. This is a rare element for a product but the Button Buddy pulls it off perfectly, The Button Buddy fits most popular markets and demographics and can be a powerful product in each one.


The above businesses and markets will eagerly welcome a product that can boost  sales and excitability. Our market profile fits Adults, Teens and Children and even Pets! --- Adults will use and love them! Teens will go crazy for them, and children will play with them.

AND EVERYONE WILL WANT THEM!


What We Need & What You Get

Tooling and first run product minimum        $12,500
Packaging                                                   $2,500
Buttons, designs and accessories              $5,000

Every donation, pre-order or gift pushes us closer!

All funding goes towards these items --- if we do not reach our Indiegogo.com goal we do have secondary back-ups in place to ensure we launch and produce our holders.  We have plenty of pre-order interest from all over the world.


Our perks are fun custom and collectable! Not only do you get product you in some cases can help us design and create themes for our button packages.

Other Ways You Can Help! Designs! designs! designs!

Help us get the word out buy sharing us on your social pages we'll compensate you with a special gift! even if you don't donate! Ask us about images and links you can share!

For every 300 social media or email people you share our project with!
Receive an Official 1â€ Button Buddy Holder with necklace & an authentic 1â€  Numbered IndieGoGo button

Help us get the word out buy sharing us on your social pages we'll compensate you with a special gift! even if you don't donate! Ask us about images and links you can share!

Please email proof, links etc and must be verifiable data!

story:
National American Miss Pre-Teen Pageant National's

Hi, My name is Riley and I am a 10 year old with big dreams!  I am on the far right in the picture (that would be your right).  I was nominated by the National Honor Society to audition for the National American Miss North Carolina Pre-Teen pageant.  This is a NO MAKEUP, ALL NATURAL pageant.  It was held in Winston-Salem, NC...not far from Greensboro, so me and my mom went.  Not only did I get accepted to compete but I won 3rd runner up! The categories that I competed in were Formal Wear, Introduction and Interview, although I was very nervous it helped me to gain confidence and it gave me an opportunity to meet some really great friends.  An optional contest was the Casual Wear/Runway Modeling (now this was up my alley!)  I placed 2nd runner up and had a great time!

I Need Your Sponsorship

Placing 3rd runner up means that I am part of the Queen's Court and I will be competing at Nationals in the National All-American Miss pageant.  This is a pageant were I proudly get to represent my city, Greensboro, NC.  The pageant is being held in Disneyland, California and the sponsorship fee is $795.00.  I also get to compete in the National Casual Wear/Runway Modeling.  The entry fee for that competition is $175.00.  The total fee is $970.00.

The Impact

As my sponsor, your name will be listed in the Program Book at the National competition.  Your sponsorship will help me continue to gain self-confidence and poise.  You will be helping me realize my dream of becoming a casual wear model, but most importantly you will help me experience something that not a lot of kids my age get to experience.  I love to meet new people and my mom always tells me I have a big heart...I didn't really know what that meant until a couple of years ago...I guess she thinks I am a pretty sweet kid.  I love to help people and this pageant will give me an opportunity to get involved in several community service projects. 

Anything You Can Contribute Will Help

I know sometimes people can't always give what they want.  I completely understand.  Anything you give will be much appreciated, even if it is just a word of encouragement.
 
Thank you in advance,
Riley

story:
Simple. Stylish. Sustainable.

Teddy Rose makes simple, stylish, and sustainable products. We attack the use of unsustainable materials in apparel while empowering other sustainability entrepreneurs to achieve their own crowdfunding goals. 


Our Goals and Your Perks

INITIAL FUNDING GOAL - $10,000

If we reach this goal with your help, a majority of the funds will be spent making your gear: Teddy Rose shirts, water bottles, plantable postcards, and other perks. 

We'll also give a portion of this funding total to three sustainability-focused crowdfunding campaigns, which are featured below (see Green Snowball Effect).

If we don't manage to reach our initial funding goal, we receive none of the funds, so please, help spread the word!

STRETCH GOAL - $25,000

With this ambitious target, we will fund a life-cycle cost assessment to analyze the efficiency of Teddy Rose's supply chain and identify areas we can improve. We want to ensure that we have the latest science-based, peer-reviewed research to back our products.

While there are existing scientific studies and life-cycle cost assessments related to bamboo viscose (here and here), we want to run our own so we can provide our customers with the most responsible products and the transparency they need to remain conscious consumers. 

In return for your support, we have some sweet products on the right that all touch one element of sustainability, from growing plants to carrying water to wearing Teddy Rose duds! 


Tees Made from Bamboo Viscose


In Chinese culture, bamboo is a symbol of friendship, vitality, and strength. We like to imbue those virtues in our shirts which are made from bamboo viscose. Here are some more reasons we love bamboo as a raw material:

  • Quick growth
  • Minimal water usage
  • Zero pesticides
  • Reduced soil erosion
  • No need to replant
  • No monoculture
  • Protects water table
  • Hypoallergenic


Style With an Earnest Ethos

Created by Zach Bogoshian in San Francisco, California, Teddy Rose is inspired by the 26th President of the United States: Theodore Roosevelt. 

Teddy brought an aggressive, brave, and tireless energy to conservation efforts. He lived life to the fullest, but understood that we humans should be conscious of how our actions are a part of Earth's past, present, and future.

Teddy Rose products are: 

  • Simple - tees made from bamboo viscose
  • Stylish - three clean, iconic designs
  • Sustainable - sales help fund other eco-entrepreneurs achieve their own crowdfunding goals

We have three clean designs, available for both men and women. 

Teddy


Yosemite


Striped TR

Men's Shirts: 

  • 70% Bamboo Viscose, 30% Organic Cotton Blend
  • Sharp and sturdy - perfect for braving a tough hike or a hard night out
  • Sizes: S, M, L, XL, 2XL

Women's Shirts: 

  • 100% Bamboo Viscose
  • Soft, light, and breathable - smooth like silk but stronger and more flexible
  • Sizes: S (4), M (6), L (8), XL (10)

Our manufacturer is Ecodesignz, who makes our Spun Bamboo® products. Here is a description of the product from their website: 

"All our clothing is made in China, where the bamboo grows. As far as the conditions under which our products are produced, we are the actual manufacturer and are involved in every step of the production process, from the sourcing of our bamboo fiber to the spinning of the yarn to the packaging and labeling of our finished garments. As well as owning our own cut and sew factory, our bamboo plantations are the first to be certified organic, the actual bamboo fiber is Oeko-Tex Standard 100 certified and we are ISO 9001:2000 certified."


The "Green Snowball Effect"


We want to lead by example. Not only are we creating our own sustainable product, but we're giving funds to three other crowdfunding campaigns that do the same. 

After our 30-day crowdfunding campaign, we'll feature these projects monthly on our website. By doing something as simple as buying a shirt for yourself or a friend, you can empower projects that champion sustainability from other angles.

Featured Campaigns:

Rocks & Gravel Coffee: Organic Eco-Roasts To Your Door
Small batch, organic, fair trade coffee, shipped direct from roast in recyclable & collectible tins.

Wild Beauty Products: Biodegradable Shampoo Bottles
Natural, cruelty-free shampoo and biodegradable bottles for hotels and natural health stores. 

HEATWORKS Model 1: Your Next Water Heater! 
The most energy & water efficient, reliable & versatile water heater available.


How You Can Help


The easiest way to help is to support our campaign! No guarantees you'll feel as awesome as Teddy Roosevelt riding a moose. But it's close.

Whether you are able to contribute yourself or not, there are other ways you can lend a helping hand: 

Share us on Facebook. Here's some text you can use: 

Check out these stylish bamboo tees from Teddy Rose: igg.me/at/teddy-rose

Share us on Twitter: 

Check out these stylish bamboo tees from @teddyroseco: igg.me/at/teddy-rose #TeddyRose

Achieving the world's sustainability goals comes from every level. Our niche is here. We're not just selling hip, sustainable products, but also helping some do-ers get their projects rolling.

Teddy once said "the joy of living is his who has the heart to demand it." I've put my heart into this project. I'd love to have you along for what comes next.

-Zach


Email: info@teddyrose.com
Twitter: @teddyroseco
Instagram: @teddyroseco
Facebook: facebook.com/teddyroseco

Teddy brought an aggressive, brave, and tireless energy to conservation efforts. He lived life to the fullest, but understood that we humans should be conscious of how our actions are a part of Earth's past, present, and future.
Teddy Rose products are: 

Simple - tees made from bamboo viscose


Stylish - three clean, iconic designs


Sustainable - sales help fund other eco-entrepreneurs achieve their own crowdfunding goals


We have three clean designs, available for both men and women. 
TeddyYosemiteStriped TRMen's Shirts: 
70% Bamboo Viscose, 30% Organic Cotton Blend
Sharp and sturdy - perfect for braving a tough hike or a hard night out
Sizes: S, M, L, XL, 2XL
Women's Shirts: 
100% Bamboo Viscose
Soft, light, and breathable - smooth like silk but stronger and more flexible
Sizes: S (4), M (6), L (8), XL (10)
Our manufacturer is Ecodesignz, who makes our Spun Bamboo® products. Here is a description of the product from their website: "All our clothing is made in China, where the bamboo grows. As far as the conditions under which our products are produced, we are the actual manufacturer and are involved in every step of the production process, from the sourcing of our bamboo fiber to the spinning of the yarn to the packaging and labeling of our finished garments. As well as owning our own cut and sew factory, our bamboo plantations are the first to be certified organic, the actual bamboo fiber is Oeko-Tex Standard 100 certified and we are ISO 9001:2000 certified."The "Green Snowball Effect"We want to lead by example. Not only are we creating our own sustainable product, but we're giving funds to three other crowdfunding campaigns that do the same. After our 30-day crowdfunding campaign, we'll feature these projects monthly on our website. By doing something as simple as buying a shirt for yourself or a friend, you can empower projects that champion sustainability from other angles.Featured Campaigns:Rocks & Gravel Coffee: Organic Eco-Roasts To Your DoorSmall batch, organic, fair trade coffee, shipped direct from roast in recyclable & collectible tins.Wild Beauty Products: Biodegradable Shampoo BottlesNatural, cruelty-free shampoo and biodegradable bottles for hotels and natural health stores. HEATWORKS Model 1: Your Next Water Heater! The most energy & water efficient, reliable & versatile water heater available.How You Can HelpThe easiest way to help is to support our campaign! No guarantees you'll feel as awesome as Teddy Roosevelt riding a moose. But it's close.Whether you are able to contribute yourself or not, there are other ways you can lend a helping hand: Share us on Facebook. Here's some text you can use: Check out these stylish bamboo tees from Teddy Rose: igg.me/at/teddy-roseShare us on Twitter: Check out these stylish bamboo tees from @teddyroseco: igg.me/at/teddy-rose #TeddyRoseAchieving the world's sustainability goals comes from every level. Our niche is here. We're not just selling hip, sustainable products, but also helping some do-ers get their projects rolling.Teddy once said "the joy of living is his who has the heart to demand it." I've put my heart into this project. I'd love to have you along for what comes next.-ZachEmail: info@teddyrose.comTwitter: @teddyrosecoInstagram: @teddyrosecoFacebook: facebook.com/teddyroseco

story:
Hi, 

we are Sarah and Dinah from Studio Lilesadi. We are originally from Germany but our studio is based in Rotterdam. 

We were tired of boring cutting boards and have designed graphical eye-catchers made of wood for your kitchen and living room.

The cutting boards come in a form of a bear and mountain. They can be used as cutting board, bread board, cheese or cake plate, or hot plate. They bring fun in your home and are as well very decorative.  

The clothes hook makes your wall in the entry, sleeping room or kitchen look stunning and can be used to hang your clothes, jackets or even jewelry.

We have produced a limited edition together with two small Dutch wood working companies. As a material we chose high quality steamed beech wood. To achieve the bear and the mountain shapes the wood goes through a lot of hands. The wood needs to be CNC milled and then at a later stage the graphic lines have to be burned into the wood in a really detailed process. After this they need to be polished and oiled by hand. 

The manufacturer can only offer more economic production methods starting from 150 pieces on. Support our project and help us reach an amount of 5.000 Euro. That allows us to purchase a bigger volume of beech wood for a good price to be able to produce 150 pieces of the bread boards and racks

How you can support our design project

The concept is really simple, you get a high quality design product at an exclusive Indiegogo price and we can pre-finance our project. 

Your can chose one of the following products, just have a look, maybe you find something you like or to give as a gift.

The rewards

5  Euro - Mini Art Work of your choice

6 Euro - Tape Rainy days

12 Euro - Set of 3 Mini Art Works

15 Euro - A mug of your choice

25 Euro - 2 Mugs of your choice

34 Euro - Bread Board Mountain or Bear

39 Euro - Cushion Dots (color of your choice)

49 Euro - Bread Board and Mug of your choice

55 Euro - Clothes Hook Mountain


ABOUT THE MANUFACTURER

Terdo CNC is a reputable Dutch company specified in wood work! About ten years ago they founded their company and with their understanding of the product, and the capacity of computerized CNC milling they are THE partner for us to achieve a high quality wood product.


// for more images go to www.lilesadi.com or email hello@lilesadi.com


Though You may not be into new bread boards, perhaps one of your friends might? Please help spread the word by re-posting the link to this site to your friends and contacts. 

THANK YOU SO MUCH FOR YOUR SUPPORT

story:
Yes, true. This is not an actual 3D Printing device. The SpaceOne ATS-1 doesn't incorporate any 3D Printing technology in itself. SpaceOne ATS-1 may look like a small spaceship or, like a Hi-Tech donut with the hole in the middle. That hole in the middle is the core of the system, because it's where the 3D Printing technology will seat.

The innovation sitting in that hole consists in the possibility to switch non only between different materials but also different technologies, while the machine is working, without interrupting the process, automatically managed by the program, even in the absence of the operator, unattended, overnight. 

SpaceOne ATS-1 will save you a lot of money and also space in your workshop. 

  • Less machines = a smaller setup footprint  is required
  • Less machines = less maintenance issues
  • Less machines = less power consumption
  • Less machines = a much easier learning curve
  • Less machines = A great SAVING
  • SpaceOne ATS-1 = Higher flexibility and performance than multiple machines.

Add SpaceOne ATS-1 to your new or existing machine and start thinking at it as a totally new tool, not just like an improvement to your standard technology.

  • SpaceOne Automatic Technology Switching allow you to store multiple tools and use them at will, in the same working session, automatically driven by the program, eventually unassisted.
  • Tools do not need to be homogeneous to each other. Be creative and mix any tool you desire and which will add a new spark to your creations.
  • Refine your jobs while still in the original setup. Less moving means more accuracy and less chance to do mistakes.Also it will improve productivity, a lot !

This lead to a number of immediate and recognizable advantages:

  • Switch multiple materials, colors, thickness and densities, requiring separate nozzles to work.
  • Provide backup nozzles, already loaded with the material and, in case of failure, the machine will automatically switch the device, without compromising the job.
  • Switch between totally different technologies, without requiring any modification to the printer, nor a special setup. Actually, the printer will automatically unload the dismissed tool and will load the required one, updating the software setup, and checking the functionality of the system. Ready for a new job. From FDM ABS to Ceramic Printing in a matter of seconds.
  • Do jobs which would do almost impossible to do with existing technologies alone.
  • Save a considerable amount of Money and Space. By equipping a single machine with the SpaceOne ATS-1 system, you'll have all the benefit of multiple machines in the footprint of a single one. 

 

The tool-holder inner diameter is 80mm to fit the commonly available 2.2KW water cooled spindle motor. Three ring adapters are provided as standard, to fit smaller size tools with diameters of 70, 60 and 50mm.
2D drawings and 3D models are included in the accompanying DVD, together with detailed instructions, allowing you to machine your custom rings.

You will have an almost unlimited number of tools available on your machine, up to 5 per single session as standard, however it will be possible to setup larger racks with more available slots if the machine size allows. 

You can fit your 3D machine with the following tools, and more:

  • Multiple FDM extruders (to print multi-color, multi-material, multi-size)
  • Plastic Pellet Extruders, single or double auger, not limited to filament availability.
  • Hot and Cold Paste Extruders for food printing, from chocolate to dougths, cream, decoration, glazing.
  • Commercial and Custom Paste Extruders for Ceramic and Porcelain printing. 
  • Concrete Mix Extruders for Contour Crafting applications.
  • Wax extruders for jewelery and metal casting
  • Polymer Clay extruders, for kids and serious model makers, artists, prop makers.
  • 3D Digitizers (Laser, Optical, Sonic, Touch Probes)
  • Cutting Wheels for Contour Cutting glass, leather, cardboard, film, paper...
  • Up to 25W compact Lasers for Engraving and Cutting.
  • Motor Spindles for CNC milling, drilling and trimming.
  • Marking devices.
  • Vacuum cups for Pick & Place applications.
  • Anything else you may like to use, if it fits the 80mm diameter ring. 


You don't have to be concerned about different tool heights. The SpaceOne ATS-1 system managing software will allow you to calibrate each tool and to store the calibration data in the software memory. Calibrate one, use them all together at your will, no more headaches.

Almost all the 3D Printing and CNC manufacturing technologies share one common element: they all rely on a motion system to work. It could be a traditional 3 Axis or Multi-Axis Cartesian system, it could be a modern Delta Robot or Stewart Platform, but it might also be a robotic arm. It doesn't matter, which one. If you need different technologies, most of the time it means you need more machines or complicate setup modifications.

Are You concerened about the minimum size of the machine?

Do not be worried. The SpaceOne ATS-1 can fit almost any size. Of course this model has been designed to suite a slightly larger range of machines, sporting bigger and heavier tools. However, as clearly depicted in the figure above, a small machine with a footprint of only 600x600mm (only 50% larger than the smaller Rep-Rap printers on the market) will convenientely fit the SpaceOne and 3 ATS-1 rack slots. And it will offer a much larger building envelope than available on those "little" machines.
However, we're already working on a feasible solution for those "little ones" which happen to be just a bit too smal for the ATS-1. Coming soon. 

SpaceOne protect your Investment when you need to grow larger.

Because SpaceOne ATS-1 is not a closed system. It's not custom tailored on a specific machine or configuration. SpaceOne ATS-1 will be the core of your 3D Printing/Fabbing system. And it wil stay with you forever, protecting your valuable investment in money, time and knowledge. You'll never need to learn a new procedure. As long as your needs expand and grow, you'll only need a larger frame, new guides and motors (eventually), and you're done. All your existing tools will come along, with SpaceOne, and you can add more, specifically tailored for the new requirements, but you're not losing your old ones. You'll be able to move from a traditional 3-axis machine to a robotic arm or to a Delta platform and even to a 6DOF Stewart platform. SpaceOne will always be there.

SpaceOne ATS-1 is modular and fits the standard 80x40 aluminum extruded profiles.

Our professional Experience

We are a small group of professionals who have been working together for almost a couple of decades. Our current localization, spread over Europe, Middle East, Asia and Africa has been highly beneficial to this project.

Actually, if two of us didn't have the chance to move to Mali on a mid term consultancy basis, and to get in touch with the wonderful People of this extremely poor Country, this project might not even been conceived.

Our proven capability to work together at distance and to remotely manage complex projects involving several time-zones will guarantee the success of the project and the timely delivery of the perks.

A proven experience in field.


With more than 35 years of professional experience in the field of Industrial and Product Design, and a strong knowledge about most of the current manufacturing techniques, we can feel pretty comfortable when it's matter of designing and launching a new product. We have been involved in every single aspect of the product design and development, including the engineering and industrialization process, for several products, both for industrial application and for the consumer and IT market. 

Our R&D team in Italy comes from approx. 20 years of professional experience in the field of Power Electronics, TV manufacturing and small robotics. 

Together, we have been involved on several complex projects, which also included overseas tool development and product manufacturing. We have acquired a good expertise in the management of suppliers and goods on the Asian market.

We transferred this knowledge to this project as well.

And now, please Help us to support the project "Laboratoire pour l'Afrique"

Help to support the development of Mali


We arrived in Mali on August 1st 2013, as consultants for a project, coming from several years living in Dubai (UAE), quite an impact.

However, what caught us almost immediately was not the extreme poverty of this Country, considered by UN one of the poorest Countries in the World and just coming out from a period of tension, insurgencies and war. 

No, the most impacting aspect of this Country were the People. They're really some of the nicest souls we ever met. Always smiling, Malians are very social and love to entertain. Despite their extreme poverty, they're also highly dignitous and respectful.

Bamako, the Capital, is quite a chaotic City of approx. two millions. And with the most chaotic and polluted traffic you could imagine. No, you just can't. The Market is spread all over the town, everyone is selling something, and this happens also in the small villages. They make a living somehow.

We decided we had to do something to help, if possible. And it was immediately clear that we didn't want to do anything similar to what most of the ONG do. Charity.

Charity doesn't solve the problems of this area of the world, it's not what they need, even if beggars are almost everywhere and all ages, yet again very dignitous and respectful.

Development is what this Country needs.

We were here for professional reasons and we soon encountered some huge problems. Almost everything is imported here, quite common issue in Africa, and availability of good materials and technical products is really scarce. Costs are also very high, due to high customs duties, and thanks to a massive corruption.

What we noticed, even in the largest companies we visited, was the lack of recent machineries, equipments and technology.

Almost everything looks dated in the late seventies. Mostly old supplies from the Sovietic support in the eighties, or French.

We've got in touch with some local institutions, especially with the Universities. And we decided we could and should do something in the field of Education.

So far, we discussed some ideas with the Universities, especially with the management of the University of Architecture in Bamako, and launched our project named "Laboratoire pour l'Afrique". A three phases project which final ambitious goal is a Technological Campus to support the local Universities.

This campaign serves the first step of the project, and the SpaceOne technology has been purposely developed for the machines we aim to donate to the local Universities.

With your help, we will build at least two large size 3D Printers equipped with the SpaceOne ATS-1 technology, and several extruders/tools, especially clay and cement mix extruders, due to the nature of the faculties. 

These machines will be of great support to teach the Malian students the modern technologies and their application to the engineering, hydraulics, architecture and design.

We don't really need to guide them in their growth. Give them the necessary information and the proper technology, and they will develop their own projects.
This is what they actually need.

By the way, they're already helping all of us, because if it was not for this project we would hardly have developed this innovative technology.

It might be one of the first times ever that such an innovative technology [for the 3D Printing] has been developed in Africa.  And we're pretty proud of this fact.


What We Need & What You Get

As you can see, we have chosen the flexible-funding formula, and we did for a couple of reasons:

  • Our main and original goal is to fund the project "Laboratoire pour l'Afrique", which is a multi-phase long term project. SpaceOne contributes to the first phase. Two more are already planned as described on our web pages. Whatever we'll raise on this campaign will help and serve as a start and a fundation for the next phases. The more we get, the better.
  • Based on 35+ years on experience in the field of Industrial Design and Product Development, we know very well how things may develop quite differently along time. We considered several aspects of this project and we simulated several possible scenario in which the campaign could develop.
    We did our best to cover almost every possible situation, from the most concervative to the truly optimistic one.
    To be ready to fullfill our promise in any case.
  • We're pretty happy to say that we have a full backup plan and we will be able to delivery the perks even if the project will not be fully funded.
  • To delivery the first two printers to the Bamako Universities - as per our first goal in the Laboratoire pour l'Afrique project - we will need approximately 35,000.00 USD, we can achieve this in a relatively simple way, without special tooling.
  • To achieve the desired quality, consistency and economy, we have to go on a Mass Production scale, and we need molding tools as well as custom assembly tools. We need to reach at least 125,000.00 USD to get to this point.

Here a preview of some of the offered perks:

Get a set of 5 custom made Postcards, stamped by the Post Office in Bamako, shipped at your destination together with two Button Pins with the logos of "Laboratoire pour l'Afrique" and our program "Meals for Kids".
Plus your name in the Hall of Fame of the "Laboratoire pour l'Afrique" contributors, on the web and on the printed book as well.


Get a beautiful T-Shirt together with two Button Pins with the logos of "Laboratoire pour l'Afrique" and our program "Meals for Kids" and the DVD "the Journey" covering several aspects of this enthusiasming project.
Plus your name in the Hall of Fame of the "Laboratoire pour l'Afrique" contributors, on the web and on the printed book as well.

Get a set of Carbon Fiber links for your Delta Robot style 3D Printer or for your 6 Axis DOD Stewart Platform. These links come together with the Uniball Rod Ends and the custom made joints to fit our SpaceOne ATS-1 Delta platform.
Plus your name in the Hall of Fame of the "Laboratoire pour l'Afrique" contributors, on the web and on the printed book as well.

Get a full Basic setup for your 3-Axis machine or your Robot Arm. The SpaceOne ATS-1 comes with the "standard" interchangeable flange, and a full set of accessories, ready to be installed on your new project or on your existing 3D Printer
Two DVDs included:

  • The SpaceOne ATS-1 Owner's Manual with all instructions, a copy of the "Enhancing your Workshop - Goes 3D" eBook, several ready to build projects, accurate 2D drawings and 3D Models, and more.
  • "Laboratoire pour l'Afrique - The Journey" DVD, covering several aspects of this enthusiasming project. lot of photos and movies of Mali.

Plus your name in the Hall of Fame of the "Laboratoire pour l'Afrique" contributors, on the web and on the printed book as well.

Get a full DELTA setup for your custom Delta Robot 3D Printer or 6 DOF Stewart Platform.
The SpaceOne ATS-1 comes with the "DELTA" interchangeable flange, and a full set of accessories, ready to be installed on your new project or on your existing 3D Printer
Two DVDs included:

  The SpaceOne ATS-1 Owner's Manual with all instructions, a copy of the "Enhancing your Workshop - Goes 3D" eBook, several ready to build projects, accurate 2D drawings and 3D Models, and more.

  "Laboratoire pour l'Afrique - The Journey" DVD, covering several aspects of this enthusiasming project. lot of photos and movies of Mali.

Plus your name in the Hall of Fame of the "Laboratoire pour l'Afrique" contributors, on the web and on the printed book as well.

The COMBO KIT is an excellent package for builders and anyone who likes to experiment and develop. The package includes a full setup for your custom Delta Robot 3D Printer, 6 DOF Stewart Platform or a standard 3-Axis cartesian motion system.
The SpaceOne ATS-1 comes with both the "DELTA" and "Standard" interchangeable flanges  [You chose the one to use], and a full set of accessories, ready to be installed on your new project or on your existing 3D Printer

Two DVDs included:

  The SpaceOne ATS-1 Owner's Manual with all instructions, a copy of the "Enhancing your Workshop - Goes 3D" eBook, several ready to build projects, accurate 2D drawings and 3D Models, and more.

  "Laboratoire pour l'Afrique - The Journey" DVD, covering several aspects of this enthusiasming project. lot of photos and movies of Mali.

Plus your name in the Hall of Fame of the "Laboratoire pour l'Afrique" contributors, on the web and on the printed book as well.

Be the first among 100 to get the first batch of SpaceOne ATS-1 sets, get TWO in one package and double your 3D Printing and Fabbing capabilities. The DUAL PACK is an excellent package for builders and intensive users. The package includes a full setup for your custom Delta Robot 3D Printer, 6 DOF Stewart Platform or a standard 3-Axis cartesian motion system.

The SpaceOne ATS-1 comes with two complete heads: the "DELTA" and the "Standard", plus a full set of accessories, ready to be installed on your new project or on your existing 3D Printer

Two DVDs included:

  The SpaceOne ATS-1 Owner's Manual with all instructions, a copy of the "Enhancing your Workshop - Goes 3D" eBook, several ready to build projects, accurate 2D drawings and 3D Models, and more.

  "Laboratoire pour l'Afrique - The Journey" DVD, covering several aspects of this enthusiasming project. lot of photos and movies of Mali.

Plus your name in the Hall of Fame of the "Laboratoire pour l'Afrique" contributors, on the web and on the printed book as well.

What if we will not reach the target ?

As previously stated, we carefully evaluated all possible scenarios, including the less exciting one, missing the target.
We designed the project in order to be responsive, so far we will be able to fulfill all the requests, only it will probably take longer and there will be no frills.
If the Mass Production target will not reached, we will not be able to use Magnesium Alloy and PA66/40% Carbon as planned, we will use Aluminum 6061 or ADC12. It will ensure the same quality, but a longer process, and more expensive to us.
The products will be slightly heavier, of course.

Also, we will not be able to supply the product in the nice, polished packaging we've designed. Standard shipping packaging will be used instead. Still safe but not so appealing.

We will not be able to ensure the printing of the book. We won't say no at the present time, we're concerned that it could be difficulto to do it.

And, of course, we will have much less resources to fund the "Laboratoire pour l'Afrique" as we planned, which would make us pretty sad.

You'll be able to move from a traditional 3-axis machine to a robotic arm or to a Delta platform and even to a 6DOF Stewart platform. SpaceOne will always be there.SpaceOne ATS-1 is modular and fits the standard 80x40 aluminum extruded profiles. Our professional Experience
We are a small group of professionals who have been working together for almost a couple of decades. Our current localization, spread over Europe, Middle East, Asia and Africa has been highly beneficial to this project.Actually, if two of us didn't have the chance to move to Mali on a mid term consultancy basis, and to get in touch with the wonderful People of this extremely poor Country, this project might not even been conceived. Our proven capability to work together at distance and to remotely manage complex projects involving several time-zones will guarantee the success of the project and the timely delivery of the perks.A proven experience in field.
With more than 35 years of professional experience in the field of Industrial and Product Design, and a strong knowledge about most of the current manufacturing techniques, we can feel pretty comfortable when it's matter of designing and launching a new product. We have been involved in every single aspect of the product design and development, including the engineering and industrialization process, for several products, both for industrial application and for the consumer and IT market. Our R&D team in Italy comes from approx. 20 years of professional experience in the field of Power Electronics, TV manufacturing and small robotics. Together, we have been involved on several complex projects, which also included overseas tool development and product manufacturing. We have acquired a good expertise in the management of suppliers and goods on the Asian market.We transferred this knowledge to this project as well. And now, please Help us to support the project "Laboratoire pour l'Afrique"Help to support the development of Mali
We arrived in Mali on August 1st 2013, as consultants for a project, coming from several years living in Dubai (UAE), quite an impact. However, what caught us almost immediately was not the extreme poverty of this Country, considered by UN one of the poorest Countries in the World and just coming out from a period of tension, insurgencies and war. No, the most impacting aspect of this Country were the People. They're really some of the nicest souls we ever met. Always smiling, Malians are very social and love to entertain. Despite their extreme poverty, they're also highly dignitous and respectful. Bamako, the Capital, is quite a chaotic City of approx. two millions. And with the most chaotic and polluted traffic you could imagine. No, you just can't. The Market is spread all over the town, everyone is selling something, and this happens also in the small villages. They make a living somehow.We decided we had to do something to help, if possible. And it was immediately clear that we didn't want to do anything similar to what most of the ONG do. Charity.Charity doesn't solve the problems of this area of the world, it's not what they need, even if beggars are almost everywhere and all ages, yet again very dignitous and respectful. Development is what this Country needs. We were here for professional reasons and we soon encountered some huge problems. Almost everything is imported here, quite common issue in Africa, and availability of good materials and technical products is really scarce. Costs are also very high, due to high customs duties, and thanks to a massive corruption. What we noticed, even in the largest companies we visited, was the lack of recent machineries, equipments and technology. Almost everything looks dated in the late seventies. Mostly old supplies from the Sovietic support in the eighties, or French.We've got in touch with some local institutions, especially with the Universities. And we decided we could and should do something in the field of Education. So far, we discussed some ideas with the Universities, especially with the management of the University of Architecture in Bamako, and launched our project named "Laboratoire pour l'Afrique". A three phases project which final ambitious goal is a Technological Campus to support the local Universities. This campaign serves the first step of the project, and the SpaceOne technology has been purposely developed for the machines we aim to donate to the local Universities. With your help, we will build at least two large size 3D Printers equipped with the SpaceOne ATS-1 technology, and several extruders/tools, especially clay and cement mix extruders, due to the nature of the faculties. These machines will be of great support to teach the Malian students the modern technologies and their application to the engineering, hydraulics, architecture and design.We don't really need to guide them in their growth. Give them the necessary information and the proper technology, and they will develop their own projects. This is what they actually need. By the way, they're already helping all of us, because if it was not for this project we would hardly have developed this innovative technology.It might be one of the first times ever that such an innovative technology [for the 3D Printing] has been developed in Africa.  And we're pretty proud of this fact.What We Need & What You GetAs you can see, we have chosen the flexible-funding formula, and we did for a couple of reasons:
Our main and original goal is to fund the project "Laboratoire pour l'Afrique", which is a multi-phase long term project. SpaceOne contributes to the first phase. Two more are already planned as described on our web pages. Whatever we'll raise on this campaign will help and serve as a start and a fundation for the next phases. The more we get, the better.
Based on 35+ years on experience in the field of Industrial Design and Product Development, we know very well how things may develop quite differently along time. We considered several aspects of this project and we simulated several possible scenario in which the campaign could develop. We did our best to cover almost every possible situation, from the most concervative to the truly optimistic one. To be ready to fullfill our promise in any case.
We're pretty happy to say that we have a full backup plan and we will be able to delivery the perks even if the project will not be fully funded.
To delivery the first two printers to the Bamako Universities - as per our first goal in the Laboratoire pour l'Afrique project - we will need approximately 35,000.00 USD, we can achieve this in a relatively simple way, without special tooling.
To achieve the desired quality, consistency and economy, we have to go on a Mass Production scale, and we need molding tools as well as custom assembly tools. We need to reach at least 125,000.00 USD to get to this point.
Here a preview of some of the offered perks:
Get a set of 5 custom made Postcards, stamped by the Post Office in 
Bamako, shipped at your destination together with two Button Pins with 
the logos of "Laboratoire pour l'Afrique" and our program "Meals for 
Kids". Plus your name in the Hall of Fame of the "Laboratoire pour l'Afrique" contributors, on the web and on the printed book as well.Get a beautiful T-Shirt together with two Button Pins with the logos of 
"Laboratoire pour l'Afrique" and our program "Meals for Kids" and the DVD "the Journey" covering several aspects of this enthusiasming project. Plus your name in the Hall of Fame of the "Laboratoire pour l'Afrique" contributors, on the web and on the printed book as well.Get a set of Carbon Fiber links for your Delta Robot style 3D Printer or for your 6 Axis DOD Stewart Platform. These links come together with the Uniball Rod Ends and the custom made joints to fit our SpaceOne ATS-1 Delta platform. Plus your name in the Hall of Fame of the "Laboratoire pour l'Afrique" contributors, on the web and on the printed book as well.Get a full Basic setup for your 3-Axis machine or your Robot Arm. The SpaceOne ATS-1 comes with the "standard" interchangeable flange, and a full set of accessories, ready to be installed on your new project or on your existing 3D PrinterTwo DVDs included:

The SpaceOne ATS-1 Owner's Manual with all instructions, a copy of the "Enhancing your Workshop - Goes 3D" eBook, several ready to build projects, accurate 2D drawings and 3D Models, and more.

"Laboratoire pour l'Afrique - The Journey" DVD, covering several aspects of this enthusiasming project. lot of photos and movies of Mali.
Plus your name in the Hall of Fame of the "Laboratoire pour l'Afrique" contributors, on the web and on the printed book as well.Get a full DELTA setup for your custom Delta Robot 3D Printer or 6 DOF Stewart Platform. The SpaceOne ATS-1 comes with the "DELTA" interchangeable flange, and a full set of accessories, ready to be installed on your new project or on your existing 3D PrinterTwo DVDs included:  The SpaceOne ATS-1 Owner's Manual with all instructions, a copy of the "Enhancing your Workshop - Goes 3D" eBook, several ready to build projects, accurate 2D drawings and 3D Models, and more.  "Laboratoire pour l'Afrique - The Journey" DVD, covering several aspects of this enthusiasming project. lot of photos and movies of Mali.Plus your name in the Hall of Fame of the "Laboratoire pour l'Afrique" contributors, on the web and on the printed book as well.The COMBO KIT is an excellent package for builders and anyone who likes to experiment and develop. The package includes a full setup for your custom Delta Robot 3D Printer, 6 DOF Stewart Platform or a standard 3-Axis cartesian motion system. The SpaceOne ATS-1 comes with both the "DELTA" and "Standard" interchangeable flanges  [You chose the one to use], and a full set of accessories, ready to be installed on your new project or on your existing 3D PrinterTwo DVDs included:  The SpaceOne ATS-1 Owner's Manual with all instructions, a copy of the "Enhancing your Workshop - Goes 3D" eBook, several ready to build projects, accurate 2D drawings and 3D Models, and more.  "Laboratoire pour l'Afrique - The Journey" DVD, covering several aspects of this enthusiasming project. lot of photos and movies of Mali.Plus your name in the Hall of Fame of the "Laboratoire pour l'Afrique" contributors, on the web and on the printed book as well.Be the first among 100 to get the first batch of SpaceOne ATS-1 sets, get TWO in one package and double your 3D Printing and Fabbing capabilities. The DUAL PACK is an excellent package for builders and intensive users. The package includes a full setup for your custom Delta Robot 3D Printer, 6 DOF Stewart Platform or a standard 3-Axis cartesian motion system. The SpaceOne ATS-1 comes with two complete heads: the "DELTA" and the "Standard", plus a full set of accessories, ready to be installed on your new project or on your existing 3D PrinterTwo DVDs included:  The SpaceOne ATS-1 Owner's Manual with all instructions, a copy of the "Enhancing your Workshop - Goes 3D" eBook, several ready to build projects, accurate 2D drawings and 3D Models, and more.  "Laboratoire pour l'Afrique - The Journey" DVD, covering several aspects of this enthusiasming project. lot of photos and movies of Mali.Plus your name in the Hall of Fame of the "Laboratoire pour l'Afrique" contributors, on the web and on the printed book as well.What if we will not reach the target ?
As previously stated, we carefully evaluated all possible scenarios, including the less exciting one, missing the target. We designed the project in order to be responsive, so far we will be able to fulfill all the requests, only it will probably take longer and there will be no frills. If the Mass Production target will not reached, we will not be able to use Magnesium Alloy and PA66/40% Carbon as planned, we will use Aluminum 6061 or ADC12. It will ensure the same quality, but a longer process, and more expensive to us. The products will be slightly heavier, of course. Also, we will not be able to supply the product in the nice, polished packaging we've designed. Standard shipping packaging will be used instead. Still safe but not so appealing. We will not be able to ensure the printing of the book. We won't say no at the present time, we're concerned that it could be difficulto to do it.And, of course, we will have much less resources to fund the "Laboratoire pour l'Afrique" as we planned, which would make us pretty sad.

story:
Thoughtful Minds is a clothing brand committed to creating timeless pieces that inspire others to BE GREAT

Help us manufacture our first collection!

Our Story 

The story behind my Brand Thoughtful Minds generated from my Grandmother Dorris Green and how she was my role model growing up and she didn't even know it. As a matter of fact, as I think back to my childhood days, I can remember word from word what my Grandmother use to tell me. She used to say "Be Great, it was a mindset she embedded in me as long as I was determined and worked hard, I could be anything I wanted to be in life. See, my Grandmother has always been a thoughtful and giving person. She always believed in giving back to the community and has always given me her support, no matter what crazy Idea I came up with . My Grandmother has always been the heart & soul to my family. Unfortunately, she was diagnosed with breast cancer in 2012 and survived it for a year or so. While my grandmother was sick I created Thoughtful Minds and I launched 2 tshirts and 1 snapback that I sold online that was successful also have received so much support from family, friends and now I need your help to expand the line and help launch my fall collection with more product and into the hands of people all around the world. 

 What drives me as a young designer is my grandmother words of wisdom, encouragement that she gave to me and her thoughtful ways to others. I want my designs not only to be stylish but to inspire individuals that they can do anything they put their mind to and they can BE GREAT in their own way. 

 Eventually the cancer spread thought out the rest of my grandmother body. In August of 2013 my grandmother passed away, and in the honor of my Grandmother I want my fall collection to be in the memory of her. In addition to also build a foundation that will always honor my Grandmother and her belief in me and my dreams.

MISSION STATEMENT

We at Thoughtful Minds are looking to make an unforgettable statement. Thoughtful minds not only exist to transform your Imagination, by providing the most exclusive, inexpensive, up to date and stylish high-end couture feel, street wear, but we aspire to refine daily life by providing fashion with a cause. Our company is established to use our abilities to captivate the minds of our customers and connect with them on an emotional level. The collection of causal and a pinch of sophistication includes stylish statement wristbands, hats, outerwear, and t-shirts.

MADE IN THE USA 

Everything from the fabric to the packaging is made in the USA. Like recently successful Indiegogo projects Thoughtful Minds, we’re committed to bringing jobs to the U.S.A


Products


Be Great (Front)


Be Great (Back)



I've spent $5,000 of my own money on screen printing, labels, samples, and patterns. Everything is ready to go, all we need is your help to help fire up the machines and start on the first production run.

Producing goods in America has its hurdles. Being a start-up with limited resources, screen printing requires a high minim for us to stay competitive on costs. Reaching our goal of $8,000 would allow us to successfully launch our first signature line. 

If we surpass our goal, we'll be able to finish development work on our jackets and button ups. Please help us launch Thoughtful Minds!

Join Us and Help Spread The Word

Keep up with everything Thoughtful Minds related by checking us out on the following social media platforms

After you support us, we would love if you help spread the word by email, facebook, twitter, or what ever you prefer. Thanks

Thank You

So thats our story and on behalf of my family and I we want to say thank you very much for taking the time out to check out our campaign! If you like what you see, we'd really appreciate your contribution. Every dollar counts! Without you, this dream wouldn't be possible & for that reason we are forever grateful!
