story:
Hi everybody ! Thanks for checking out our project



Homemade Fabric is what we've always been dreaming to create for many years, but our different choices in life have never allow it. I work in the north of Italy, Andrea lives in London, coming back to Italy one time a month for business and Giovanni is just back from US after a long period also in the UK; we came to terms this is the perfect moment to seize our dream.

 

 

 

 

We aim to satisfy different kind of people, betting on our own tastes, on what we like; choosing t-shirts to start up our adventure.

 

 

Insert Coin

is the first collection we've created as very representative of our main concept

 

 

 

 

The grafic style of the 80's videogames is hard to forget for us, so many hours spent in front of the old videogames.These simple words "insert coin" bring our memory back to that moment, when the coins for a new game were over. Now we're grown ups, insert coin means getting you to gamble on your cards, take the chances, move on your ideas forward, make it real and show it to the world.

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

Hero

 

 

 

 

Tilt

 

 

 

1P

 

 

 

 

Rock Fabric

 is the second one, dedicated to three icons became mouthpieces of entire generations, not only for music but also for their style, attitude and life philosophy. Rock Fabric points out the thoughts of these artists, underlining how nowadays some their words are extremely actual and enhancing their cultural influence over art.

 

 

 

 

 

 

Kurt 

 

  

 

Jimi 

 

 

  

David 

 

 

 

Rock Fabric tees are in grey color too

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

When Giovanni told us about Indiegogo we were really impressed ! You guys know better than us how a smart way like this can be important for people starting up something they believe in.

We are excited to have this opportunity and share it to the world. Hopefully you share our vision and willing to become a part of our story by making a pledge and history.

 

 

 

 

 

Our goal to raise over $ 5,000 will go towards production of our collections :



  • Establishing an inventory with existing designs.

  • adding new ones

  • fulfilling the perks

We appreciate each and every deed you can do.

We've spent a lot of money to register the copyright and we're lucky to have great friends that helped us for the other stuff like the samples t-shirts, the photo shoot, the video and the website.At this time we need your support to make our dream come true.

 

 

 

 

We choose an important company which usually works for accomplished Italian brands, able to guarantee quality and professionality.

We wanna make comfortable high quality t-shirts only with a particular style and woven so we decided for the cotton slub type, raw cut neckline and raw cut sleeves 100% cotton durable, lightweight, in order to let the tees breathe and fit perfectly on your body.

Concerning screen printing we choose the best quality, the t-shirts most people are used to are made by putting ink onto the shirt (plastisol) and over time the image can crack and peel.We wanted to avoid this. The discharge process lifts dye from the shirt leaving you with an image that is literally part of the fabric and undetectable to the touch.

 

 

 

 

Select a method of pledging found on the right. Once Indiegogo releases the funds, we'll get to work on starting production.

Once ready for delivering we'll contact you again requesting you to confirm your choice.

 

 

 

 

Are the colors shown the only ones available? Will you be adding more later?

  

Yes and maybe! The colors shown are the only ones we have available right now.

 However, we'll start adding new color options (and even new tees!) depending on popular demand.

 

    

What about the size ?

  

S – M – L – XL european standard sizes, we'll send to you all the details about the measurements.

   

 

Do you confirm mailing addresses before shipping?

   

Yes. So if you're planning to move before we ship, don't worry.

  

 

 

 

We're ready to give our best to capitalize on your support, we've always been waiting for a chance like this.We've put our life apart to start up this adventure, believing in our skills and betting on them.The chosen company for the production is on standby, waiting for us to give it the green light and we've planned to ensure the successful completion of all perks (no matter how many) in a timely manner.

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

Tell anyone that owes you a gift. If no one owes you a gift, tell them you deserve one. Buy yourself a gift. Buy a friend a gift. Buy your loved one a gift. Just pledge and make Homemade Fabric a reality!

 

 

 

Moreover, let's keep in touch !

 

 

 

Thank you for taking the time to learn more about us. We are forever grateful.

story:
About us

We are a team of two European Landscape Designers living, and starting up our own business in Ireland. We are also both passionate about dancing Tango.

The team:

Tünde Szentesi, leaving behind Hungary and her professional career as an HR consultant, moved to Ireland 7 years ago to pursue her hobby – Gardening. She earned a degree as a Landscape Architect at the University of Gloucestershire in England. At the moment she is working as a Gardener/Designer in Dublin. In her creations she would like to express practicality, beauty and harmony combined with innovative solutions.She  tries to reflect her artistic sensibility by applying colors and forma in a new, exciting way.

Svaja Vaicula graduated with distinction from Senior College Dun Laoghaire with a BTEC Higher National Diploma in Landscape Design.  Having graduated with a Diploma in Garden Design from Vilnius College Lithuania, she relocated to Dublin to further her education and career. With an in-depth knowledge of both practical and design aspects of horticulture her design philosophy revolves around the communication between hard and soft landscape elements putting special emphasis on an organic sustainable approach. She holds the Winner of BLOOM 2008 award for small garden design.

About the Project

We created “Eco Tango Garden” - a fun dancing and dining sustainable outdoor living space.

Our concept of the design is to illustrate how people can create a greener garden from recycled materials on a small site (ours is 5m by 7m). They can grow food and have a lot of fun in a sustainable way. We’re eating, playing, exercising-relaxing, and dancing Argentine Tango in our garden!

We take a holistic attitude to the gardening. It is important because we need to consider all the needs of humans and plants in order to achieve a good healthy and happy environment that we all desire.

In our fresh approach to sustainable garden design we’re delivering a stylish garden that uses resources efficiently and at the same time we save time, money, effort, and materials. We look for techniques to find the greenest solutions. We are creating a sustainable garden without compromising on design. We are also reusing materials in a creative way: 

Canopy from Utoplast (recycled melted plastic innovated by Juli Laczko (plastenka.hu); vertical wall from pallets; stage and footpath from scaffold planks, just to name a few.

 A significant part of our sustainable scheme relates to the way we manage rainwater. In our garden, it is harvested using the canopy and then directed to different parts of the garden. Some is collected; some goes directly to irrigate the plants, while the excess is soaked away.

In our planting pattern we are using aesthetically pleasing, edible and medicinal plants. We have chosen a dominant white flower colour scheme for its healing properties. We’re using red poppy flowers for interest and contrast and to express a Tango passion.

We are hoping that with your help we will achieve completion of our dream garden on Bloom show 2013!

This show is Ireland's largest gardening, food and family event which takes place annually in the Phoenix Park Dublin during the June Holiday weekend (30th May - 3rd June 2013). Bloom 2012 was the 6th year of the event, attracting almost 80,000 visitors to the 70 acre site. - including Designer gardens, Garden expert stage, Food Village, Floral marque etc. More information here:http://bloominthepark.com/

For us this is a huge opportunity to show our ideas, how to be more environmentally conscious and have fun at the same time.

Be part of it!

Let’s bring together two great passions– Gardening and Tango

We would like to introduce simple and smart ideas to show how you can make a nice environment with a small effort and with edible plants, and forgotten herbs like wild garlic (Allium ursinum) or woodruff (Gallium odoratum). And we would like to give opportunity to other artists, who have got innovative ideas like Juli, who innovated the Utoplast recycled canopy material.

We will be very delighted to raise 2500 Euro. With this amount of money we will be able to complete our show garden to the highest standard possible.

Be a participant of Bloom 2013 and give us a huge opportunity to teach people to be more environmentally conscious.  

Our unique perks will give you lots of information about sustainable living, edible plants, herbs and Argentine Tango. You will also be able to share your experiences with us and Eco Garden Community.

Let’s build a society committed with open minded people who can live in a healthy and fun way.

We will list all of our special supporters on our Eco Tango Garden Community page, and send them a very special thank you for all of you.

We really hope that we can reach our goal and we can show our ideas in this garden festival. It might not… we still would like to share our thinking, and organize workshops’.

You can follow our project here and on our Facebook website:

http://www.facebook.com/pages/Eco-Tango-Garden/361061294010807

Feel free to contact us,

ecotangogarden@gmail.com

We’ll check it and will get back to you!

Other ways to help: 

We are truly grateful for your attention and contribution. Please spread the word if you like our Eco Tango Garden. Share it!

Like us on Facebook:

http://www.facebook.com/pages/Eco-Tango-Garden/361061294010807

Please promote the Eco Tango Garden project any way you can think of.

Every little helps!

Thank You!
Our Blessings,

Tünde and Svaja

story:
Amae Love wants *your* help to create your favorite clothes & jewels! Let me take you with me on my journey...

Hello beautiful people, I'm Amae Love. A question: Have you ever wanted that perfect clothing item or accessory that's made just for you? NOW is the time to help me deliver that to you just in time for festival season, at a lower cost available to anyone else, while you help me realize my dream of making my next album! (You can hear & enjoy my conscious-bluesy-soulful musical creations so far at www.amaelove.com.)

"Album? I thought this was for a clothing line..." you may be thinking. Allow me to explain: Being a designer is what makes it *possible* for me to be an independant musician. With funds raised from this campaign, I will be able to produce a new line and make a living from the income while I work on and fund my next album. It gives me a way to expand my business and make a long term living, therefore giving me the freedom to remain independant, produce conscious and high integrity music with no compromises, and to be able give my music as a gift if I choose. I've been doing this already but on a smaller scale, without the the ability to truly save money to make the album, or the time to focus fully on what it will really take to launch my music career. In today's music climate, artists need to develop themselves, and there is so much I want to give. I am dedicated to helping raise consicousness on the planet through music, and to true sustainable health of the body, spirit, and planet through everything that I do.  I know am on the cusp of taking my design business and my music career to the next level and with your help, I will be able to:

  • produce a higher volume of product, adding up to more profit,
  • do more wholesale, adding up to more free time,
  • and hire one employee,

Therefore freeing up my time to devote myself fully to music! WOW that would make me cry tears of joy. If I meet or exceed my goal, this will insure I will have enough after selling my production to fund my new Gospel-Soul-Blues album, all about empowerment, following the heart, and turning challenges into treasure. :)

SO, in exchange for this blessing, my intention is to create a win-win-WIN by using this campaign as a means to deliver customized orders at a lower cost to you, while I use your feedback to create the best designs yet! It support me and it supports you, AND the wonderful famliy of tailors I work with.

What We Need & What You Get

SO basically, it's very simple: the perks/rewards ARE the designs!

  • Funds raised will go DIRECTLY to the prodcution and delivery of the clothing, including fabric, sewing costs, and shipping, plus a very small amount to admistitrative costs. (I have already paid for my own travel costs.)
  • You can get any of the designs already available *right away* if you use PayPal (please see my etsy store: https://www.etsy.com/shop/amaelove) OR donate towards one of my NEW designs, yet to be revealed, and get first dibs on what I bring back. SCORE!!
  • People who donate will have first choice of limited edition designs, new designs, and be able to order their items with custom colors or measurements- all for LOWER PRICES. This will NOT be available to anyone else! The more you donate, the better deal you get!
  • Your feedback will help me get a better idea of what people want and I produce accordingly.
  • I will produce clothing according to the money I raise. The more, the better!  The funds will then multiply and turn into the income I live on. If I meet or exceed my goal, I can independantly fund my new album.
  • Use the various perks creatively to get anything you want, especially the higher levels. All of my deisgns don't fit into 12 catergories! I am willing to work with you to make sure you are one happy camper.

I also want to involve you in my journey. Follow me as I take you fabric shopping, post music videos I make, work with my tailors, and explore the amazing magic of Bali. This will be a fun way for us to get to know each other better and for you to see who I am, what I do and how I do it. Part of my intention is to empower other artists to also have the freedom to realize their dreams, and I believe sharing my own process is a valuable step. Together we are powerful! Crowd funding is a powerful tool that can bring us closer to each other no matter where we are on the planet.

I have already completed a successful KickStarter campaign for my Music Video, "The Amazing Birthday song," an uplifitng, soulful & fun catchy little ditty meant to be an alternative to the boring old birthday song. It is a gift for all of us to be able to send online to our loved ones on thier special day, to help celebrate and remind them of who they truly are. This journey of the Kickstarter & making the video allowed me to see the magic of what we can create together and I want to keep going!
Please check out the "Amaezing Birthday Song" and spread the love!
http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=ZSJT5o12Vzg
 

Other Ways You Can Help

You may not be able to contribute, but that doesn’t mean you can’t help:

  •  Get the word out by telling your friends and posting this up on facebook, twitter, your blog, etc!
  •  Use the Indiegogo share tools!
  • Tell you friends about Amae Love Designs, show them the Etsy store, Play them the music, and get people talking about this project.

I look forward to developing and sharing my creative talents with all of you from Bali  during this campaign! Please be in touch and let me know how I can be of service to your deisres.

Blessings & LOVE!

Amae Love

story:
Its sleek, compact and lightweight design makes the TOOLETRIES Bathroom Travel Case the perfect product for anyone that travels or for those that want a stylish storage space to keep their bathroom neat and tidy! It’s a great gift for Father’s Day, birthdays, Christmas and for yourself too! 


What is the Tooletries Bathroom Travel Case?

The TOOLETRIES Bathroom Travel Case is a toiletry case that has the aesthetics of a traditional tool case and the functionality of a toiletry bag. The unique hard-shell, heavy-duty exterior has been custom designed to protect your toiletries from the rigours of travelling, and your clothes and personal items from any spills or leakages. And its compact and lightweight design means it fits nicely with your luggage requirements. It also acts as a stylish and convenient storage unit for your bathroom goods. There is ample space to store your toiletries and its sleek design means it looks good in any bathroom.


Our Story

Men are pretty hard to buy for at the best of times. And tools and toiletries have always been a go-to gift when buying for men. So we thought it might be fun to combine the two. But first we needed a name for this concept and just like that, TOOLETRIES was born.



Our Vision

Here at TOOLETRIES we want to make sleek and innovative bathroom products for men. We do this by combining the aesthetics of tools with the functionality of toiletries. Our focus is to bring products to market that are unique and specifically designed for men. 




Help get production started

After several months of designing, testing materials, and sourcing best in class toolmakers and manufacturers, we are finally ready to bring our TOOLETRIES Bathroom Travel case to market. But we need your help to fund our initial order. Every dollar we raise will go towards production. In return for your support, we are offering a variety of packages that we hope you love.

Rewards
Our biggest goal with this Indiegogo campaign is to get the TOOLETRIES Bathroom Travel Case manufactured and in suitcases and bathrooms everywhere. As a reward for helping us achieve this, you can get yourself a travel case at a special introductory price. We have a number of options down the right hand side of the page that we hope will suit anyone in the market for a cool travel case, bathroom storage unit or awesome gift. At the end of the campaign we will ask you which color(s) you would like out from the choices of Toolbox Red, Gunmetal Grey and Matte Black.


Risks and Challenges
1. We already have prototypes made and they are currently being tested for functionality and durability. Our production team is ready to produce full orders as soon as funding is received.

2. We have ample experience creating and delivering various products. We have used a leading Industrial Design firm for our product design. We have experience with toolmakers and manufacturers, who are ready to fulfill our orders once the campaign has ended.

3. Delays and unforeseen circumstances can sometime occur. Although highly unlikely, our supporters and backers will be the first to know should something arise.

story:
Remember that episode of Seinfeld when George Costanza’s wallet over-stuffed with receipts, burst open like parade confetti? We laughed back then, because we could relate. We were still a paper world…in the 1990’s.

But now in 2014 I have launch Eniana wallet, the spacious minimalist leather wallet.

Eniana Wallet is lightweight, secure, slim, and designed to go where you go. Put it in your front pocket, slip it into your purse. Our wallet is perfect in any situation from the beach, to bar, to the boardroom.

Eniana wallets are made of soft Italian leather and high-quality elastic.

WE WANTED A WALLET THAT:

  • is lightweight
  • adapts to the user, not the user having to adapt to it
  • works for right and left handed people
  • is pleasant to touch
  • is minimally designed
  • can handle any climate and environment
  • will never wear out
  • allows easy access to cash, credit and business cards
  • wouldn’t be limited to a fixed number of cards you could carry

Eniana wallet with 8 credit cards  + 1 ID card + 2 business cards + 2  x $20 bills + 5 coins

So, it had to do all these things and still have a design that was minimal and looked amazing!

MEET ENIANA: A MINIMALIST SPACIOUS WALLET

The technological development of smart gadgets made carrying around all that unnecessary stuff, like coins, receipts and year-old loyalty cards a thing of the past. The next step was to design a new concept of wallet for the modern, active person who hates schlepping around all that unessential stuff.

Eniana wallet was created having exactly this in mind - to be a super-thin, card-carrying over-achiever. Because we believe that all you really need in your wallet are your essential cards and cash.

10 credit cards + 3 x $20 bills + ID card inside Eniana wallet and a similar content with a regular wallet

WHY ENIANA IS BETTER: A WALLET DESIGNED TO STRETCH
We observed that many of today's minimal wallets fail because the material stretches out leaving it unable to hold a smaller number of cards. The beauty of our durable, leather-elastic design is that Eniana stretches and wraps tightly around your cards but still having a classy leather design. Whether you carry 10 or 20 cards one week and then 2 cards for the weekend, Eniana will never stretch out or lose its ability to grip your cards or cash, and will make you look stylish in any situation.

Eniana wallet with 8 credit cards + 1 ID card + 2 business cards + 2 x $20 bills + 5 coins

ENIANA IS AMAZINGLY THIN
At only 7 mm, Eniana is as thin as the cards in your pocket.

ENIANA IS EASY TO ACCESS
Eniana keeps the cards you use most at your fingertips. So helpful!

ENIANA IS COLORFUL
We made Eniana in six colors. One for everyone (Red, Orange, Brown, Blue, White, Black).

DESIGN: BEAUTY & FUNCTION

When we decided to create a new design for a modern wallet, we wanted something that was simple, functional, trendy and felt good to handle. Not being satisfied with what we could find on the market, we decided to rethink the wallet by rethinking the way we carry our everyday objects. After months of prototyping and testing different designs, we've tailored the Eniana Wallet into something we absolutely love to carry in our pockets, purses and bags.

It had to be adaptable to any situation and environment, securely hold the items you placed in it and protect them at all times. It had to have as little stitching as possible, because that's where most wallets start to fail - at the seams.

THE PERFECT FIT FOR YOU

REASONS TO SUPPORT:

  • Using an Eniana wallet makes your pants fit better.
  • Eniana is easy to find in your bag or purse although it is a minimal wallet.
  • It's small in your pocket, and it's only as big as you need it to be.
  • Cards are easy in and easy out.
  • To respect the silhouette of the butt.
  • It's hard to make your wallet stand out, but an Eniana stands out, without actually standing out.
  • It's so versatile; use your imagination to decide how you'll use it!
  • It comes in cute individual Eniana packaging perfect for gifting.
  • Easy mailing. Easy gifting.
  • Christmas shopping - Done!

THE PLAN

The funds raised through this project will be used to produce the Eniana wallet line, which includes six different leather colors. It will help with the costs associated with a large scale production run, including ordering all necessary supplies.

To prepare for a large order, I have enlisted the help of a sewing house in Milano - Italy that has agreed to help prepare Eniana wallets in time for shipping to customers. 

WALLET SPECS:

  • Dimensions: 9cm/3.55" x 6cm/2.36" x 0.7cm/0.28"
  • Material: Full Grain Leather & Elastic
  • Pockets: 5
  • Capacity: up to 20 Cards + Cash
  • Colors: Red, Orange, Brown, Blue, White and Black                                          

FEATURES:

  • Securely holds 1 up to 20 cards.
  • Cards, cash, coins and business cards can be easily put in and taken out.
  • The slim design is barely noticeable in front or rear pocket.
  • The leather & elastic wallet weighs in at only 27 grams/0.95 oz. making it ultra-light.
  • Durability, I use the best Italian full grain leather.

I have used my Eniana wallet for the last 7 months and it still looks like new.

JOIN OUR TEAM

This is where you come in. We need your help to get this product on the market and in your pocket. We are looking for people who are searching for ways to slim down and simplify their lives. People who believe it makes more sense to carry only what you need - not everything you own. Your support will help us cover the costs of our first production run.

OUR PRODUCTION PLAN

We have completed an intensive, 7 month-long prototyping process with our tailoring team to solve any durability problems and challenges we might face as we move into production. The next step is to place the order for materials and start the first production run of wallets.

Production schedule:

  • Celebrate the successful end of our campaign with some tasty pancakes
  • Week 1: Place order for materials and schedule production
  • Week 1: Place order for packaging
  • Weeks 2-4: Wallet production and print packaging
  • Week 4: Check every wallet to make sure they are perfect
  • Week 5: Package wallets for shipment
  • Ship! We expect to start shipping all orders in October.

So please back our project. If you are unable to back our project, please help us in getting the word out to your friends and network – we’ll give you mad love and you’ll have the satisfaction in knowing that you played a vital role in rise of Eniana wallets!

Thanks again for your time and for checking out our project!

story:
Be sure to check the Gallery to view swatches or view a hi-res version here

So, why geek culture?

I've always been a nerd, a geek, a dork, a gamer, and I'm proud to wear those titles! Growing up my nights were spent with a flashlight under my blanket reading books and playing Game Boy and my days were spent playing Nintendo with my big brother.

Video games were the cornerstone of my childhood! Even now, over a decade later, just thinking about playing Bubble Bobble or Super Mario brings back that warm, fuzzy feeling that only nostalgia can produce. Every so often I find myself pulling out the Nintendo and settling in for a long night of nostalgia.

What does my pledge go towards?

This project is to order additional supplies for larger-scale production. My initial investment in the glitter suspension nail polish base, glitter, empty bottles, and other various supplies for very small-scale production was over $100 out-of-pocket. For larger-scale production I can't afford the $300+ out-of-pocket. Your contribution will make a difference! Every bit helps :-)

What other collections are you planning?

I already have 5 collections planned and awaiting prototyping:

  • Harry Potter
  • Doctor Who
  • Lord of the Rings
  • Invader Zim
  • Super Mario

Once my first collection has completed its first run I'll be mixing up prototypes for another collection.

The boring stuff regarding rewards

Every pledge, even $1, will give you your name on a very special "Thank You" page on my blog. Every donation counts and I am grateful to each and every person who pledges!

For rewards, each mini is valued at $5 and each full size is valued at $10. By pledging you get discounted shipping! If you order polish during my pre-order phase (which will come after this funding phase) you will have to pay full shipping so pledge now, save some money!

You can mix and match mini and full-sized polishes for your reward up to your pledged amount. For example, if you pledge $50 you can get 3 full sized and 2 minis; 4 full sized; 8 minis; etc. Email me at Kyoti@KyotisNails.com with any questions. Once supplies are ready to be ordered I will contact you for the colors/sizes you want.

Thank you for helping make this dream a reality! I couldn't do this without your contribution! Please spread the word to ensure I reach my goal!


Descriptions of the colors:

  • Bolero of Fire
    • Medium red and orange
    • Small gold and orange
  • Requiem of Spirit
    • Medium orange and yellow
    • Small gold and orange
  • Minuet of Forest
    • Medium emerald green
    • Small green and gold
  • Serenade of Water
    • Medium light and dark blue
    • Medium square blue
    • Small light blue
  • Nocturne of Shadow
    • Medium square purple and square black
    • Small purple and black
  • Prelude of Light
    • Medium square silver and hex gold
    • Small gold
    • Tiny rainbow
  • Song of Storms
    • Medium square silver
    • Small black and light blue
    • Tiny rainbow
  • Navi
    • Medium square silver and light blue
    • Small light blue
  • Link
    • Medium emerald green
    • Small light brown, gold, and light blue
  • Epona's Song
    • Medium brown and emerald green
    • Small light brown and green
  • Ganon
    • Medium emerald green, red, and brown
    • Small black and light brown
  • Zelda
    • Medium square purple
    • Small purple and gold
    • Tiny rainbow

story:
After a successful end to our Indiegogo campaign, we've moved the party to our website!  To see the latest from Trash Amps and order your own soda can speakers, visit:

www.trashamps.com

 

We are Trash Amps – we transform soda cans into portable speakers to get people thinking, “What are things we throw away that could have a new use?” 

Instead of raising money from a venture capitalist to pay for production, we’ve created this campaign on Indiegogo to do some “crowd-funding” – you pre-order the product at a special price, and we use that money to fund the first production run!

Here's the basics:

The Book of Trash Amps

Click on a chapter to read more:

Chapter 1   Rewards 
Chapter 2   History of Trash Amps 
Chapter 3   Customer Feedback: Gen 1 
Chapter 4   Everything about Gen 2 
Chapter 5   So Many Uses 
Chapter 6   Manufacturing Plan
Chapter 7   Intended Time Line
Chapter 8   We’ve Got Credentials
Chapter 9   More About Us
Chapter 10 Frequently Asked Questions

Chapter 1 - Rewards

For your financial support of our project, we offer you these perks!

Go back to Table of Contents

Chapter 2 – History of Trash Amps

In college, our friend got an Altoids guitar amp kit online. It was a cool idea, but it didn’t sound great because it’s such a small enclosure.  The same electronics worked great in a soda can. Then came the realization: you can put music in anything – Trash Amps was born.  After showing a few prototypes to friends, we knew there was a market for a product like this.  Adam graduated in 2009 (Manufacturing Engineering) and joined forces with Ron (Electrical Engineer) to get Trash Amps going.

After a small run of Gen 0, which utilized PVC pipe and off the shelf parts, we wanted to up the level of quality.  We raised money from family and friends for an injection mold – we wish we would have known about Indiegogo then!  We built 500 Gen 1 Trash Amps, which quickly sold through our website and booth at the local mall for $50 each. So, we made 1000 more.  We’re talking 1,500 units made by hand on the dining room table.  In Sept 2012, we sold the last Trash Amp Gen 1!

As the Gen 1 phase of our project ends, we are anxious to start the next: we are ready to bring out Gen 2!

Go back to Table of Contents

Chapter 3 – Customer Feedback: Gen 1

Here are a few emails we received from customers who purchased Gen 1:

Joyce from Phoenix, Arizona writes:

"This is a truly awesome product, I have now bought 5 of them online. These are awesome and affordable gifts!"  

Debbie "Librarian" from San Francisco, California writes:

"I just want to tell you how much I love my amp. I bought it at the Makers Fair in San Mateo, CA and I use it with my electric ukulele. I am a librarian at a middle school and I am spreading the word! When the students come into the library they are amazed how good it sounds!!! Thank you until the end of time and beyond!"

Brad from Queensland, Australia writes:

"I found out about Trash Amps from a Tumblr Blog I follow. My Trash Amp arrived yesterday and I love it. It's perfect to listen to tunes without having to pop in some ear phones when I sit down and read a book. Sometime over the weekend it'll get a test run on my brothers Bass guitar. I'll see if I can't convince him to get his own Trash Amp to practice with to avoid annoying the neighbourhood all the time. Would love to stay in touch, and if I find myself back in the US again, I'm looking you up and we're going for beers and pizza. And you've got a place to stay in Australia too if you come down here on holiday."

Tony "Mad About Portable Music" from San Jose, California writes:

"Shweeeet Product!!! Caught you gents at a local gift faire in San Jose! Watched and listened to a few people ask very specific questions, and then bought one myself. Having tried many MP3 portable speakers in the past, I was a little skeptical, but plugged my ipod shuffle in, and of course pumped up the volume...and I was friggin amazed! Nice device! Having an art background, I was dually impressed with the packaging, especially the cardboard tube. I definitely like the concept of old stuff turned into something new and useful. Well done guys. I'll be sending many friends and family your way!"

Jorge from Miami, Florida writes:

"I remember watching your video about a year ago and thinking how amazing your Trash Amp was. Since I didn't have a job, I couldn't afford it. But two things happened a week ago: my headphones broke, and I just got a job! SO, I thought about this awesome speaker that fits in a can and decided to buy one because of it's ingenuity and amazing purpose. I received the speaker in the mail yesterday, I absolutely love it! I'm using it for iPod and Guitar, and I still use the packaging as a case. I love that concept of a travel case that lives past it's shipping life. Thanks for inventing this awesome device!"

During the course of selling 1,500 Gen 1 Trash Amp Speakers, our customers gave us these three ideas to improve Gen 2.

We’ve addressed all of these issues in Gen 2. Other improvements include a more durable cord, automatic on/off, and automatic gain control.  In chapter 4, we’ll give you all the details on Gen 2, which you can pre-order by pledging $32 or more (see Chapter 1 - Rewards)!

Go back to Table of Contents

Chapter 4 – Everything About Gen 2

Here you’ll find detailed feature descriptions and photos of our latest prototypes!

Go back to Table of Contents

Chapter 5 – So Many Uses

And our speakers provide high quality, high volume sound with your favorite apps!

Go back to Table of Contents

Chapter 6 – Manufacturing Plan

We’ve completed the design work for the electronics, product and packaging in Sunnyvale, CA. We're working with a reputable turnkey manufacturing company in Oregon that employs more than 100 people in the US full time. Using our prototypes and manufacturing documents, they will produce 1000 units at their China manufacturing location.

We've looked for the past year, but never found anybody to build our product in the USA - unfortunately, it seems most products involving electronics are made overseas these days.  If you know of turnkey manufacturing in the USA for our speakers, please contact: info@trashamps.com - we would love to build it here if posssible!

We have given the manufacturer all of the documents required for production, as well as physical working prototypes of our product. The manufacturer has already sent us first articles (initial sample from manufacturer). Overall, the samples looked very good. We have analyzed these product samples and given feedback. They are now building final product samples which we should receive in early November. We will keep you posted on how they look. If you have any questions about our manufacturing plan or experience, please contact us! We love talking about manufacturing – it’s our passion!

We’ve put a ton of effort into earth friendly product design and packaging. Many of the parts are made from recycled materials, such as the black plastic end caps. Our manufacturer will use “regrind” plastic for many plastic parts in the product and packaging. Regrind plastic is plastic that would normally be thrown away, but is ground up and used again for our product.

The following items will be produced by our contract manufacturer: Indiegogo can, speaker insert, and packaging.

Due to the range of colors and designs of our magnetic grills, and the fact that we have an Epilog laser cutter, we will produce the grills ourselves. With injection molding, we wouldn’t be able to experiment with new designs, nor would we be able to produce small quantities of a variety of different colors. With laser cutting, we have complete control over color, design, and quantity. Plus, it’s fun to use the laser. After the campaign, we will purchase the acrylic sheets locally and start laser cutting. After they are cut out, we will glue on the magnet and send them with your speaker!

We still provide cans that have been consumed and collected in Sunnyvale, California, USA! We collect them from all sorts of folks, mostly family and friends. We clean them, cut the tops off, and make sure there are no sharp edges. When the speakers arrive, we will combine it with the can you select. We have more than 1000 cans saved up, check it out:

We made a special wall organizer for the cans. This custom design includes laser cut cardboard from old boxes. This can organizer is special because a soda can may be added or removed anywhere on the board without disrupting the other cans.

Go back to Table of Contents

Chapter 7 – Intended Time Line

All "perks" ship May 1, 2013.  Thanks for your patience!

Go back to Table of Contents

Chapter 8 – We’ve Got Credentials

We’ve worked on projects such as towel warmers and LED disc golf discs. We are skilled in woodworking, injection molding, CNC machining, solid modeling, rapid prototyping, electronic design and assembly, and the list goes on. We do a lot of consulting for local inventors with new product ideas, helping turn their ideas into working prototypes. Our current side project is a medical device for paramedics to use in the field. Got a project for us? Drop us a line!

Adam has a BS in Manufacturing Engineering from California Polytechnic State University (Cal Poly) in San Luis Obispo, CA. Ron has a BS in General Engineering and MS in Industrial Engineering also from Cal Poly. Having worked on many projects together, workflow is efficient. Adam typically does the product design, packaging design, and SolidWorks 3D Modeling. Ron specializes in electronics, circuit design, and prototype PCB creation.

Adam completed all of the product design for Gen 2. This includes SolidWorks 3D modeling, prototyping, testing, and technical drawings – everything the manufacturer needs to make the product. Adam also completed the same items for the packaging.

Ron has completed all of the electronics design. This includes circuit design, schematic creation, circuit testing and optimization using software, component library creation, board layout, prototype creation, testing and optimization of real prototypes, and creation of manufacturing documents including pick and place data, board panelization, etc. For you tech people, Ron is a very skilled PCB prototype maker, as he can put down parts as small as 0402 in the garage.

Go back to Table of Contents

Chapter 9 – More About Us

ADAM

  • Prefers nectarines to peaches 
  • Often skips breakfast 
  • Gets his best work done between 10 pm – 2 am 
  • Reads packaging textbooks for fun 
  • Writes and records original music 

RON

  • Prefers peaches to nectarines 
  • Makes the perfect cup of coffee every morning with his Aeropress
  • Has only been on an airplane 4 times 
  • Specializes in microcontroller projects 
  • Brews beer and wine 

Don’t tell anyone, but Adam is a bit of a collector. He has been collecting cans for 5 years now, and saves one of each can he comes across as a keepsake, no repeats! Now, there’s more than 500 unique cans in the Wall of Fame.

Go back to Table of Contents

Chapter 10 – Frequently Asked Questions

1. Can I choose my own soda can and grill top? Yes! Please pledge to a perk which includes “Can & Grill chosen by YOU”. After pledging, go to our website to reserve the can(s) and grill(s) of your choice: www.can-reservation.com. Limit one can and one grill reservation per CAN combo. Get your favorite can before somebody else does!

2. How loud is it? Ridiculously loud! Seriously, it will fill a large apartment or your bedroom. It’s even great for outdoor use, like backyard BBQs and beach days.  People are always surprised at how loud our speakers are!

3. How do you turn the speaker on? Trash Amps Gen 2 is SMART: it automatically turns on when music plays, and falls asleep after 30 seconds of silence. Alternatively, if you unplug the Trash Amp from your device, it automatically turns off. This really prolongs your battery life – you can’t forget to turn this speaker off and waste the batteries (user feedback from Gen 1). 

4. How do you control the volume of the speaker? The volume of the speaker is controlled by the device you plug in – turn it up on your iPod or guitar, and the speaker gets louder. Using input impedance sensing, aka “magic,” the Trash Amp automatically boosts the gain for face melting guitar solos! 

5. Will the Trash Amp work with my device? A simple rule of thumb is “if you can plug in headphones, you can plug in a Trash Amp!” Devices commonly used are smart phones, iPod, iPad, tablets, mp3 players, laptops, portable DVD players, and the list goes on. And don’t forget about musical instruments, like electric guitars (see next item)! 

6. How do I use the Trash Amp with my guitar or other musical instrument? Trash Amp is a legit guitar amplifier! We’ve seen Trash Amps used with electric guitars, electric ukuleles and keyboards. Use the ¼” adapter to plug into any standard instrument output. We include one adapter free with every CAN Combo! 

7. Can I use my own cord with the Trash Amp? Yes, the 3.5mm auxiliary jack inside the secret compartment allows you to use your own cord to connect an input. The built-in cord is 15 inches long, so especially with guitar use, it can be nice to have a longer cord so you can move around freely. 

8. Can I connect multiple Trash Amps together for stereo sound or louder volumes? The built in 3.5mm auxiliary jack allows you to connect Trash Amps together! Just plug the first unit into your device, and plug subsequent Trash Amps into the previous unit’s auxiliary jack. This lets you get even louder volumes!

9. Can I get stereo sound out of my Trash Amps? True stereo sound can be achieved using a stereo splitter between the audio source and the two Trash Amps. You can pick one up at your local electronics store.  By default, Trash Amps internally mix the left and right audio signals together, so when you daisy chain two or more together using the auxiliary jack, they each with play the mixed mono signal.

10. Can you give me some technical specs on these speakers? Trash Amps are super efficient with power consumption, offering 50 hours of battery life from 4 AA batteries (included). A 2" full range driver and 1.4W amp provide ridiculously loud music for a hangout with friends, or for an impromptu jam session. 

11. How do you cut the cans? Over the past 5 years, we’ve developed a device to safely cut the tops off the cans. Cutting cans is very difficult because they are so delicate. You want an even cut with no sharp edges. We’d love to share our method with you, but then we’d have to kill you! Just kidding… maybe someday we’ll tell, but we want you to have the chance to think through the challenge yourself! Brain exercise, a real engineering problem! 

12. Can I cut my own can? It is possible to cut a can with scissors or other tools, but please don’t kill yourself! For liability and safety reasons, “we don’t recommend it.” We include a pre-cut can with every CAN Combo so you get a straight, clean top without sharp edges. 

13. Where do the cans come from? We’ve collected cans for the past 4 years from all over the world. We have more than 1000 cans in our house, and it’s getting to be a problem. I have many “regular drinkers” that save cans for me, like my grandparents. When we go to parties, we collect the cans and take them home with us. If you live in the Bay Area and you drink lots of canned beverages, please contact us (info@trashamps.com) about becoming a can supplier! The Indiegogo Can is recycled aluminum branded with exclusive graphics – to be clear, it never had soda in it. Custom printed cans like this are becoming very popular for us because people want branding and customizability options.

14. Do you need a can on the speaker to use it? The can creates a sealed speaker cavity for a full range sound experience. Without it, the frequency response is greatly diminished. Plus the can gives you style points! 

15. Where is it made? We’ve completed the design work for the electronics, product and packaging in Sunnyvale, CA. We're working with a reputable turnkey manufacturing company in Oregon that employs more than 100 people in the US full time!  Using our prototypes and manufacturing documents, they will produce 1000 units at their China manufacturing location.

16. Can you make it in the USA? In the past 2 years, we hand made and sold 1,500 units for $50 each. These units were built on the dining room table, and to date, nobody has been paid a salary :-(  We've looked for the past year, but never found anybody who could produce our product in the USA - unfortunately, most products involving electronics are made overseas these days.  If you know of turnkey manufacturing in the USA for our speakers, please contact: info@trashamps.com - we would love to build it here if possible!  For now, we've made a decision and we're going to give it a try.  With the help of professional manufacturing, we will build a thriving business, create new jobs, and start paying salaries!

17. Is shipping included? Shipping is included for US orders.  International orders, please add $10 to your pledge.

18. When will I get my Trash Amp? If everything goes according to plan, you will have your speakers in hand by February 28, 2013. Of course, stay tuned for backer updates including delivery dates!

19. Is Coke going to sue you for using their cans? People trade and sell collectors Coke cans on eBay, right? Is that illegal? The answer is no. After some research, we’ve found the rule on selling cans: “you may sell a can as long as there’s nothing in it.” So Trash Amps has created a Speaker Insert which fits inside cans, and we also sell empty cans which you can use to customize your speaker. When our website is in normal operation, the Speaker Insert and can show up as separate items during checkout, eliminating the idea that Coke may have made the speaker. This solution overcomes licensing issues and is an integral part of the Trash Amps Patent. 

20. Do you have a patent? In September 2010, we filed a utility patent application for the Trash Amps Speaker. In September 2012, we got our first office action, and soon the patent will be granted. It’s always good to have some protection, and filing the patent was a great learning experience! Look for “Patent Pending” or Patent No. on the product when you get it! 

21. Can I purchase Trash Amps in bulk for my store? Our Indiegogo campaign is geared toward everyday folks.  The maximum quantity you can purchase through our campaign is 12 units. We’d love to talk more about wholesale possibilities with you via email, please drop us a line: info@trashamps.com. 

22. Can I brand Trash Amps with my school or company logo? Yes, but it’s not available through our Indiegogo campaign. Please drop us a line: info@trashamps.com. 

23. Why don’t you use rechargeable batteries? Many people ask us this, because we’re a “green company” and “disposable batteries are evil.” In an effort to make the product affordable to all, we’ve designed it with a 4AA battery pack which comes with 4 AA Alkaline batteries. Many customers purchase their own rechargeable batteries and charger – it’s an option for those that want it! 

24. Why don’t you use solar panels? Many people ask us this, because we’re a “green company.” To the best of our knowledge, a reasonably sized solar panel would not provide the amount of current required to power our speakers. To get the proper amount of power, you’d need a solar panel 5ft X 5ft – you lose the entire “PORTABLE” aspect of our product. Not to mention the two main requests we get from customers are: (1) can you make it louder? and (2) can you lower the price point? Adding solar panels to the mix would create power problems and increase the price point.

25. Do Trash Amps support Bluetooth? The biggest complaint we’ve had thus far is “the price is too high!” We thought about adding Bluetooth, but it adds cost, which adds to our price point problem. Our target market is high school and college students, and our price point must be appropriate for this audience. With the current product, we’ve gone for a durable, simple product that everyone can afford. BUT, if this project is successful, I promise you here and now: we will do another campaign in the future for a Bluetooth Trash Amp Speaker! 

If you read this far, you deserve a medal of honor. Thanks for your interest in our project!

Go back to Table of Contents
story_txt:
After a successful end to our Indiegogo campaign, we've moved the party to our website!  To see the latest from Trash Amps and order your own soda can speakers, visit:
www.trashamps.com
 
We are Trash Amps – we transform soda cans into portable speakers to get people thinking, “What are things we throw away that could have a new use?” 
Instead of raising money from a venture capitalist to pay for production, we’ve created this campaign on Indiegogo to do some “crowd-funding” – you pre-order the product at a special price, and we use that money to fund the first production run!
Here's the basics:




The Book of Trash Amps
Click on a chapter to read more:
Chapter 1   Rewards Chapter 2   History of Trash Amps Chapter 3   Customer Feedback: Gen 1 Chapter 4   Everything about Gen 2 Chapter 5   So Many Uses Chapter 6   Manufacturing PlanChapter 7   Intended Time LineChapter 8   We’ve Got CredentialsChapter 9   More About UsChapter 10 Frequently Asked Questions

Chapter 1 - Rewards
For your financial support of our project, we offer you these perks!



Go back to Table of Contents
Chapter 2 – History of Trash Amps

In college, our friend got an Altoids guitar amp kit online. It was a cool idea, but it didn’t sound great because it’s such a small enclosure.  The same electronics worked great in a soda can. Then came the realization: you can put music in anything – Trash Amps was born.  After showing a few prototypes to friends, we knew there was a market for a product like this.  Adam graduated in 2009 (Manufacturing Engineering) and joined forces with Ron (Electrical Engineer) to get Trash Amps going.
After a small run of Gen 0, which utilized PVC pipe and off the shelf parts, we wanted to up the level of quality.  We raised money from family and friends for an injection mold – we wish we would have known about Indiegogo then!  We built 500 Gen 1 Trash Amps, which quickly sold through our website and booth at the local mall for $50 each. So, we made 1000 more.  We’re talking 1,500 units made by hand on the dining room table.  In Sept 2012, we sold the last Trash Amp Gen 1!


As the Gen 1 phase of our project ends, we are anxious to start the next: we are ready to bring out Gen 2!

Go back to Table of Contents
Chapter 3 – Customer Feedback: Gen 1

Here are a few emails we received from customers who purchased Gen 1:
Joyce from Phoenix, Arizona writes:
"This is a truly awesome product, I have now bought 5 of them online. These are awesome and affordable gifts!"  
Debbie "Librarian" from San Francisco, California writes:
"I just want to tell you how much I love my amp. I bought it at the Makers Fair in San Mateo, CA and I use it with my electric ukulele. I am a librarian at a middle school and I am spreading the word! When the students come into the library they are amazed how good it sounds!!! Thank you until the end of time and beyond!"
Brad from Queensland, Australia writes:
"I found out about Trash Amps from a Tumblr Blog I follow. My Trash Amp arrived yesterday and I love it. It's perfect to listen to tunes without having to pop in some ear phones when I sit down and read a book. Sometime over the weekend it'll get a test run on my brothers Bass guitar. I'll see if I can't convince him to get his own Trash Amp to practice with to avoid annoying the neighbourhood all the time. Would love to stay in touch, and if I find myself back in the US again, I'm looking you up and we're going for beers and pizza. And you've got a place to stay in Australia too if you come down here on holiday."
Tony "Mad About Portable Music" from San Jose, California writes:
"Shweeeet Product!!! Caught you gents at a local gift faire in San Jose! Watched and listened to a few people ask very specific questions, and then bought one myself. Having tried many MP3 portable speakers in the past, I was a little skeptical, but plugged my ipod shuffle in, and of course pumped up the volume...and I was friggin amazed! Nice device! Having an art background, I was dually impressed with the packaging, especially the cardboard tube. I definitely like the concept of old stuff turned into something new and useful. Well done guys. I'll be sending many friends and family your way!"
Jorge from Miami, Florida writes:
"I remember watching your video about a year ago and thinking how amazing your Trash Amp was. Since I didn't have a job, I couldn't afford it. But two things happened a week ago: my headphones broke, and I just got a job! SO, I thought about this awesome speaker that fits in a can and decided to buy one because of it's ingenuity and amazing purpose. I received the speaker in the mail yesterday, I absolutely love it! I'm using it for iPod and Guitar, and I still use the packaging as a case. I love that concept of a travel case that lives past it's shipping life. Thanks for inventing this awesome device!"


During the course of selling 1,500 Gen 1 Trash Amp Speakers, our customers gave us these three ideas to improve Gen 2.
We’ve addressed all of these issues in Gen 2. Other improvements include a more durable cord, automatic on/off, and automatic gain control.  In chapter 4, we’ll give you all the details on Gen 2, which you can pre-order by pledging $32 or more (see Chapter 1 - Rewards)!

Go back to Table of Contents
Chapter 4 – Everything About Gen 2
Here you’ll find detailed feature descriptions and photos of our latest prototypes!







Go back to Table of Contents
Chapter 5 – So Many Uses





And our speakers provide high quality, high volume sound with your favorite apps!

22. Can I brand Trash Amps with my school or company logo? Yes, but it’s not available through our Indiegogo campaign. Please drop us a line: info@trashamps.com. 
23. Why don’t you use rechargeable batteries? Many people ask us this, because we’re a “green company” and “disposable batteries are evil.” In an effort to make the product affordable to all, we’ve designed it with a 4AA battery pack which comes with 4 AA Alkaline batteries. Many customers purchase their own rechargeable batteries and charger – it’s an option for those that want it! 
24. Why don’t you use solar panels? Many people ask us this, because we’re a “green company.” To the best of our knowledge, a reasonably sized solar panel would not provide the amount of current required to power our speakers. To get the proper amount of power, you’d need a solar panel 5ft X 5ft – you lose the entire “PORTABLE” aspect of our product. Not to mention the two main requests we get from customers are: (1) can you make it louder? and (2) can you lower the price point? Adding solar panels to the mix would create power problems and increase the price point.
25. Do Trash Amps support Bluetooth? The biggest complaint we’ve had thus far is “the price is too high!” We thought about adding Bluetooth, but it adds cost, which adds to our price point problem. Our target market is high school and college students, and our price point must be appropriate for this audience. With the current product, we’ve gone for a durable, simple product that everyone can afford. BUT, if this project is successful, I promise you here and now: we will do another campaign in the future for a Bluetooth Trash Amp Speaker! 
If you read this far, you deserve a medal of honor. Thanks for your interest in our project!
Go back to Table of Contents

story:
***UPDATE 9/30/10*** Revival Vintage Couture is officially launched. We have created several new designs, which I have added photos of today. Please visit our gallery to view them. We have a supporter who is throwing us a product party in the posh neighborhood of Oakwood, so we can introduce our designs to the fashionistas! We still need your help to create a professional website, and invest in more items. I promise, we are a worthwhile investment!********

My name is Brit, and I run a small online vintage clothing business through Ebay called Sleeping Goose Vintage (cute story, which I am happy to share if you ask me). It is operated out of my small home office, and I usually make much less than $1000 a month, gross. I would make much more, if I had more money to invest in the business, which would allow me to give back more (see below for my commitment to my community). I specialize mainly in vintage lingerie, purses, hats, dresses, and jewelery, and find these items by consistently attending estate sales, auctions, flea markets, thrift stores, and hunting online for the best deals possible. Selling on Ebay can sometimes be very limiting, and I would love to have my own professional website created outside of Ebay where the possibilities are endless, and I can reach many more people.

Revival Vintage is something I came up with to describe my idea of turning vintage “trash” into treasure. Items like the vintage Elsa Schiaparelli hat and the vintage gloves are treasures by themselves, but there are items which are broken, torn, stained, and just flat-out ignored at estate sales and thrift stores by prospective buyers. I see these items as treasure…I see a vintage bag with a broken strap, and imagine replacing the strap with a vintage strand of pearls, and weaving a black satin ribbon through it. I would be purchasing every one of these items if I had the money to invest in them. And I am not talking about “bedazzling”, either. I mean really giving these pieces the love they deserve, and adding artistic, creative touches to them to create something one-of-a-kind, vintage, and new all at the same time. Add vintage applique, fabrics, swag, bling, pearls, jewels, buttons, and other very high-quality one-of-a-kind items. There will be no two pieces alike. It’s a good way to stay green, and keep recycling millions of items while preserving history all at the same time. I’d like to specialize in MOD, hippie, pin-up-girl, rockabilly girl, and many more styles. High-fashion, couture, green, usable, unique…all things that will BE the business. I have such an eye for these things, and a creative mind. I have hundreds of ideas, but I need a means to start the business…I need workspace, supplies, and the means to make an initial investment in items that are just waiting for me in the tri-state area. I also need to hire someone to create a professional site, and one or two helping hands. I already have about 300 items that are potential revival candidates, but I need the right art to make them couture. I will have items to fit EVERY budget, because EVERY girl deserves a fashionable wardrobe.

The money contributed to my campaign will go towards a professionally-designed website, quality camera and lighting equipment, and some new inventory (when I say new, I mean vintage), as well as supplies to start “reviving” the fashions that defined decades past! Each item that we sell & ship will come with a “story”, about what was used to make it, and the era it came from. HELP SAVE FASHION HISTORY! I can use ANYTHING! I am a small business, and a supporter of other small businesses. This is a great way for you to give back to the community by supporting a small business! Every little bit helps the economy more than you know! I am a hard worker, and your dollars will be used appropriately!

I am dedicated to giving back to my community, and sharing with those that have made my life what it is today. I commit to donating/dividing 15% of all of my profits made from the business between the Three Sisters Animal Rescue in Cincinnati, and the Last Chance Corral Horse Rescue in Athens, OH. I already give what little I can, but I would be overjoyed to be able to give more, and more frequently. They will receive their donations on a monthly or weekly basis; not yearly, as some businesses do. The more we make, the percentage donated to them will increase. I will create certain designs that are named for certain pets in rescue, and 100% of the proceeds from those items will go to help that pet! It’s a great way to sponsor a rescue dog, cat, or horse, support small businesses and the economy, stay green, and keep your wardrobe full of new and exciting vintage couture! We will ship using recycled/recyclable/homemade materials.

I am listing my goal as 10,000 dollars. I figure I may as well dream big…the bigger I dream now, the more I can give later.

Thank you for considering to contribute to my campaign. Please see my VIP perks.

Feel free to contact me with any questions or suggestions. I would love to hear them!

Brittainy Turpin-McCoy
sleepinggoose2@gmail.com
937-414-5971

story:
Hi,

As a small innovative dutch design company, our goal is to develop better solutions to small problems.

Our kids tend to focus on everything except food, trying to get the food in we realized that the old "here comes....." could use an upgrade. 

Tatatata......the AirplaneSpoon was born, the FunSpoon with a friendly take-off sound coordinated by the captain.

  

Just press the button and the plane takes off towards your beloved hunger striker for a happy landing.

Our ambition is to develop a whole range of FunSpoons for children.  The Airplane Spoon is the kick off!

We need your support to manufacture the FunSpoon range. To set up a production range, we have to develop production moulds. Your purchase of the AirplaneSpoon provides us the means to make that possible.

For these moulds we need at least $10,000. This means that at the price of $10 a piece, we have to find a 1000 picky eaters.

With your purchase of the AirplaneSpoon, we get the opportunity to develop this product range and make dinner time more fun.

We truly hope that you and your loved ones will enjoy the AirplaneSpoon as much as our monsters do.

p.s. Unfortunately, shipping to the US costs approximately $20 per piece, while shipping to Europe costs approximately $9.50 per piece. What we are looking for are distributors per country, so we can send a large quantity to one address and distribute from there to save on costs. Please contact us if you are interested in helping us out with this one: info@airplanespoon.com

Please share the FunSpoon project with other struggling parents.

Thank you!

story:
What is The Toobie™?

Scarves, hats, and hoods have remained virtually unchanged for the last hundred years, yet weather patterns and everyday lives are busier and more demanding than ever.

The Toobie™ is an evolutionary new product designed for people that love versatility and lead active lives, going beyond boring old hats, scarves, or hoods of yesterday.

The Toobie™ can be fashioned OVER NINE WAYS! in just seconds to meet any weather condition or body temperature, going from a neck, chest & back warmer, to a face mask, balaclava, hood, hat, or the adventurous "Santa," "Jester," or "Pirate,"  with just a few adjustments.

It's easy and fun, but most importantly, it keeps you warm and can be worn by men, women, and children.

It's a hat! It's a scarf! It's anything you want it Toobie! It's simply the most versatile hat or scarf you'll ever own!

NINE Ways you can wear it!!!

1. Neck, Chest & Back Warmer


2. Face Mask

3. Hood

4. Balaclava

5. The Santa

6. Ski Cap

7. The Pirate

8. The Ponytail

9. The Jester

Various colors (see below)

Unique Design

Adding to the versatility, the Toobie's™ unique design solves a common problem in cooler weather - keeping your chest and back warm.

The gap between your coat and your body reduces your body's ability to stay warm, which often makes your back and chest cold. But because the Toobie™ is uniquely designed to cover your chest and back and your neck (when worn in the basic way), you'll stay warmer. - No more wrangling and adjusting your scarves to lay flat or cover you just right....

Perfect for...

Wearing anytime you go outside, but especially great for people that enjoy outdoor activities like:

  • Watching outdoor sporting events like soccer and football
  • Walking
  • Walking the dog
  • Hiking
  • Skiing
  • Motorcycling
  • Golfing (no hindrance of arm movement!)
  • Working outdoors (yard work, postal delivery people...)
  • And more!

And Kids Love it Too!

Kids love the fun looks they can have with the Toobie™ - my own sons love the "Ninja" (Balaclava) and my daughter loves the soft feel of the fabric and being girly girl with her stylings.

And it's especially wonderful for keeping the littlest ones warm. You'll have no problem with them trying to take it off - like a hat - when you're trying to bundle them up for the cold because it stays on securely. And when worn as a neck, back, and chest warmer, you'll feel good about having an extra layer for the little ones without a lot of extra bulk.

The Game Plan

I've teamed up with a family owned business with over thirty years experience here in America, and I've located a few reliable suppliers of fleece in order for us to receive timely deliveries once we go into production.

Your generous pledge will allow me to go into production for the Toobie™- more specifically...

Here's how Toobie™ project funds will be utilized:

  • Purchase of the necessary fleece in at least eight colors along with garment labels for our first-ever production run
  • Creation of a how-to instruction booklet
  • Creation of marketing materials to solicit stores and distributors

The Impact

100% Made in the USA! ==> I've teamed up with a family-owned manufacturer here in America with over thirty years of experience.

One day the son told me a sad story that inspired me to produce it state-side. He said that around the year 1999, the laws changed with Asian countries and business dried up in the US as companies saw opportunities to cut corners and costs by going overseas.

He went on to say that his father had purchased a lot of specialized sewing machines costing around $7000 each, that suddenly went idle. Not being used, and with dismal prospects in the near future, he tried to sell them. He received a few offers in the $100 range, sadly, so they decided to put them into storage in case things changed. 

Well, great news! We'll be using those exact machines to make the Toobie™! - and yes, there are still plenty of skilled workers that know how to use them!

Factory floor in New Jersey

This machine makes the hem.

Colors

At the present time, the plans are to produce Toobies™ and Toobie™ Juniors in the following colors:

  • Black
  • Royal Blue
  • Red
  • Purple
  • Lilac
  • White
  • Pink
  • Baby blue
  • Camoflage (not shown in pic)

Black • Royal Blue • Red • Purple • Lilac • White • Pink • Baby Blue • Camoflage not shown.

Got a favorite or desired color. Let me know. Chances are I'll be able to make one for you.

Sizes

The Toobie™ will be made in three sizes. "Regular" will fit most people.

For young adults and some adults with smaller coconuts than the rest of us, there will be a medium (smaller opening, same length as regular size).

For the little ones, the Toobie™ Junior works great. It has a smaller opening and is shorter, so it won't hang ridiculously low out of a short jacket.

At the end of the campaign, you'll be able to let me know your size and color requests.

Other Ways You Can Help

You might not be able to contribute, but that doesn’t mean you can’t help:

  • Help us to get the word out and make some noise about the Toobie™.
  • Please use the Indiegogo easy to share tools under the project video! You can post on Facebook, Twitter, Google+

Thank You!!!

Nick
